story:
Empower Teens to Break-Away from Traditional Curricula

Hi! I’m Colleen Mascenik. I’m a mother and development economist who believes that every teenager deserves the freedom to spend her time doing what interests her most. Over nearly 20 years at World Bank Group, I moved with my kids from country to country, and rather than enroll them in schools, we hired talented local artists, mathematicians, chess players and writers to work with each child, create learning plans around her or his interests, and find local volunteer work that spurred those interests along.

Now I’ve set off to build this vision into a not-for-profit organization that empowers small clusters of teenagers in the most challenging places to break-away from traditional curricula, discover their intrinsic interests, and pursue them deeply with the support of a mentor and our growing network of one-on-one chat. Check us out at www.facebook.com/breakawaylearning! With the help of my friends and colleagues, Benazir Noorzad and Simin Shokrullah, Kabul is a great place to start.

(We've also launched a learning cluster in Bo City, Sierra Leone, as you'll see on our Facebook. An Indiegogo campaign for Sierra Leone coming in July!)

What is individualized learning? For Kamal, age 14, this means advancing intensively into pre-calculus on Khan Academy, learning Python on Udemy and Codecademy, chatting with a Kyrgyz coder, and studying neural networks on Coursera. His goal is to complete the Coursera/Columbia University Micro-Masters in Artificial Intelligence in the next four years. For Maryam, age 16, this means exploring oil painting skills on Craftsy and in live studio sessions with a Ukrainian painter, while studying approaches to social media marketing on Udemy, and learning the fundamentals of art as a business on Coursera. Meanwhile, we are training Najiba, age 22 and herself an undergraduate, as a mentor who encourages and supervises the cluster, suggests additional content, and puts the students in touch with Kabul-based professionals in their chosen fields.

What does it take to create a cluster? We focus on what counts--the student. We recruit English-speaking students ages 13-20, with an emphasis on girls. We meet students and their families one-on-one, listen and work together to create learning plans that make sense for each teen. We hire and train mentors, purchase second-hand tablets and laptops for each student, borrow or rent rooms and small apartments, arrange wifi where we can get it (or shuttle students and devices to internet cafes for intermittent access and bulk downloading), we buy back-up generators and collect used furniture. Students rotate in small groups through the shared learning space for a few hours each day; some continue to be enrolled at regular schools, as required by law. In short, we do everything we can to enable focused, world-class learning as economically as possible. We charge a modest tuition fee (in Kabul, it is US$21/month, or AFN 1500) that partially covers costs. We are NOT a school and we don’t advertise ourselves as such.

What We Need

In Kabul, we have 18 enrolled students and we aim for 56. Delivering cluster learning in Kabul will cost about US$50 per student per month, of which our students pay $21 per month themselves--that’s most of the fixed and local costs. We’re asking donors to provide the other $29, the cost of students’ chatting on our marketplace of experts. (We provide monthly coupons, and students decide with whom to chat; chat-providers earn this subsidy).

If we don’t manage to reach our goal, students will have fewer chats (e.g., learning will be less personalized). We continue increasing the number of clusters to offset coordination costs, and to strike a balance between cluster size and affordability for students.

We are a U.S. registered, not-for-profit charitable organization, with Tax ID# 82-5047330, incorporated in Pittston, Maine. Your contribution is tax deductible!

Perks: Our Kabul students and experts want to share with you a bit about themselves. For a donation of $10, we’ll send you a postcard portrait of one of our students. For a donation of $29, we’ll send you a 8.5"x11" color print of Tahera’s painting. For a donation of $200, we’ll send you a 16"x20" print of Benazir’s pen-and-ink zentangle. For a donation of $1000, we’ll send you a 24"x36" art-quality photo enlargement of the whole Kabul cluster. And for a donation of $5000, we’ll create an ongoing learning cluster of at least 24 teenage students in the city of your choice within the next 6 months (All clusters are fee-based with monthly fees targeted to recover recurring costs at levels affordable to low-income families, and include learning space, local mentorship, individualized learning plans for each student, tablets and laptops for each student, wifi and utilities. Not available in Cuba, Iran or North Korea).

IMPACT: What will your contribution do?

Kabul is just the first step to get cluster-learning started. We intend to grow from the most difficult places, scaling up small, informal clusters as an alternative to traditional secondary study.

Our long-range vision is a transformation of teen education into something radically individualized, leveraging already-existing abundant free courseware, complemented by one-on-one human conversation. We’re expanding a curated, fee-based marketplace of one-on-one chat (at www.breakawaylearning.org) at the same time we build learning clusters. Our local coordinators recruit chat-providers at the same time that they run student clusters. And by subsidizing the early usage of this marketplace, we are activating brilliant and interesting voices that will become a valued resource for paying students in wealthier markets later on.

What is a marketplace of chat? Santos will talk to you about how Ebola ravaged his community and took most of the lives of his family in Sierra Leone in 2015, but how changes in burial practices and better communication saved his life ($4 for 30 minutes). Leang shares his perspective as a political opposition activist in Phnom Penh who survived an unaccounted grenade attack ($4 for 20 minutes). Tanya shares the early design inspiration for Uklon, the Ukrainian ride-sharing app that preceded Uber ($4 for 20 minutes). Steven shares the work he’s doing at Kenya Wildlife Service to apply remote sensors and drones to track elephant populations ($6 for 20 minutes). These are the voices that inspire teen learning. A young person engages in hundreds of these conversations, not necessarily to build skills or memorize content, but to explore the range of human experiences and begin to identify her passions and possibilies for development in the years ahead. 

I’m an American mom, too, so I know teenagers’ reactions. “Will this be on the test? Am I gonna get credit for it?” The intellectual laziness and grades-obsession created by secondary schools would make exploratory learning and a chat marketplace seem pointless. But it’s school that is pointless, and I’m convinced that a transformation is coming in the next 10 years. And it’s starting in the poorest cities, because those teens have the most to lose by staying on traditional paths. For the smartest teens in places like Kabul, a culture of obedient school-going is a step-ladder to nowhere; it will be replaced by a culture of creative individualism. “I study what interests me. I learn because I want to.” And that kind of inspiration is contagious.

RESULTS MEASUREMENT:

Our bottom line is different from schools, because we’re NOT a school. We don’t administer standardized tests or compare students’ (temporary) content mastery. Students get their own feedback, grades and certificates for the individually-selected courseware, chats, and tutorials they pursue. Mentors overlay that with guidance and subjective feedback. We measure across time and against control groups our students’ self-reported level of Motivation toward learning, Ownership of the learning process, and Market Readiness.

We believe we’re on to something, and that when cluster-learning works in the most difficult places, wealthier markets will begin to pay attention.

RISKS:

We are working in difficult places, and we face real risks. Our Kabul students, and particularly our girls, are vulnerable to attacks that target perceived Western cultural symbols and female empowerment. We don't share students' surnames, and only share first names with their consent. We don't publicly share the street addresses of our clusters in Afghanistan. We operate with very little concrete resources, but the ones we have are exposed. We empower our students by giving them laptops and tablets. We manage cash locally. We steward our resources through intensive local leadership, and make the most use of messaging apps as possible, both to avoid unnecessary travel risks and to dedicate as much budget as possible to delivering for our students. We’ve designed three-way monitoring, so that our coordinators and students monitor our mentors; our mentors monitor our students; and our students also report on themselves. We track our funds, but understand that the operating environment is extremely risky.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

I’m glad you’re reading about The BreakAway Learning Project, even if you don’t contribute today. You may have a new view about cluster-learning, and maybe you’ll get a cluster started in your own community. You might scroll through the chats and chat-projects on our site, at www.breakawaylearning.org, and find inspiration of your own. You might loosen up on your own teenager, and give her or him the creative space to figure out what he/she’s really into. Creative learning is contagious-- spread the word!

story:
Our Story

Studies have shown that early musical training in children helps develop brain areas involved in language and reasoning; that students who study the arts are more successful on standardized tests such as the SAT; achieve higher grades in high school; and teamwork skills and discipline are enhanced. Music provides children with a means of self-expression and music study develops skills that are necessary in the workplace.  Yet, for some time now, there has been little or no music education in the public schools.  The cost of private lessons is prohibitive at best.

Since 1937, the Boys & Girls Club of Hollywood (BGCH) has provided thousands of underserved, low income youth with a safe place to go after school.  Over 1,400 kids participate in social, recreational, and educational opportunities including MUSIC LESSONS year round.  The majority of our members (71%) live in low income households.

In 1998, the BGCH began collaborating with UCLA’s Music Partnership Program.  UCLA provides the expertise with a Music Director, music instructors, and partial funding of the program cost.  The BGCH clubhouse has two dedicated soundproofed music rooms with two pianos, a music room with an additional piano, four electric keyboards, and eight guitars.  Children between the ages of 6-15 participate in weekly lessons with UCLA music instructors in piano and/or guitar as well as the opportunity to practice daily.  The music program has attracted the attention of the club members and every year there are waiting lists for both piano and guitar lessons. 

At the end of the program year, the students perform at a concert held in UCLA’s Schoenberg Hall. These concerts provide a great opportunity for the students to perform in front of peers, students from other local schools, and the general public. Our students also perform in the annual spring and winter recitals at the BGCH clubhouse. In addition, our advanced musicians perform at community events such as the Hollywood Business Improvement District 10th Annual Celebration, the BGCH Youth of the Year Annual Celebration and the Wilshire Rotary Music Awards.

We Need Your Help

The budget for this program is $53,900 and consists of music director and instructor fees, transportation for off-site perfomances, instrument maintenance and repair.  The program provides approximately 1,925 private 30 minute lessons in instrumental performance to children and youth throughout the year.  The Ella Fitzgerald Foundation, UCLA and BGCH share the cost of the program.  BGCH needs to raise $5,000 to maintain the program at its current level.

 

All money raised will go towards the program even if we don’t make our goal.  We have unique perks for your contribution:  Anything up to $25 will get you a personalized “Thank You” card designed and created by one of our music students; $26-$50 gets you the card plus a ticket to the annual concert at UCLA Schoenberg Hall on May 27th;  $51-$75 in addition to the first two, a star in the BGCH Clubhouse Music Room with your name on it; $76-$100 will get you listed in the program booklet for the year end concert plus the aforementioned items; $101-$250 will get you invited to the dinner reception hosted by the music students after the annual concert plus the aforementioned perks.

 

Please get the word out through Facebook, Twitter, Email, and Blogs.  Help us give our youth the chance to enjoy the wonderful benefits of music. 

 

 

The BGCH is a 501(c)(3) non profit organization and all donations are tax deductible as provided by law.
story_txt:
Our Story

Studies have shown that early musical training in children helps develop brain
areas involved in language and reasoning; that students who study the arts are
more successful on standardized tests such as the SAT; achieve higher grades in
high school; and teamwork skills and discipline are enhanced. Music provides children with a means of self-expression
and music study develops skills that are necessary in the workplace.  Yet, for some time now, there has been little or no music education in the

public schools.  The cost of private
lessons is prohibitive at best.
Since 1937, the Boys & Girls Club of Hollywood
(BGCH) has provided thousands of underserved, low income youth with a safe
place to go after school.  Over 1,400
kids participate in social, recreational, and educational opportunities
including MUSIC LESSONS year round.  The
majority of our members (71%) live in low income households.
In 1998, the BGCH began collaborating with UCLA’s
Music Partnership Program.  UCLA provides the expertise with a Music
Director, music instructors, and partial funding of the program cost.  The BGCH clubhouse has two dedicated
soundproofed music rooms with two pianos, a music room with an additional
piano, four electric keyboards, and eight guitars.  Children between the ages of 6-15 participate
in weekly lessons with UCLA music instructors in piano and/or
guitar as well as the opportunity to practice daily.  The music program has attracted the attention
of the club members and every year there are waiting lists for both piano and
guitar lessons.  
At the end of the program
year, the students perform at a concert held in UCLA’s Schoenberg Hall. These
concerts provide a great opportunity for the students to perform in front of
peers, students from other local schools, and the general public. Our students
also perform in the annual spring and winter recitals at the BGCH clubhouse.
In addition, our advanced musicians perform at community events such as the
Hollywood Business Improvement District 10th Annual Celebration, the
BGCH Youth of the Year Annual Celebration and the Wilshire Rotary Music Awards.
 
We Need Your Help
The budget for this
program is $53,900 and consists of music director and instructor fees, transportation for off-site perfomances, instrument maintenance and repair.  The program provides approximately 1,925
private 30 minute lessons in instrumental performance to children and youth throughout
the year.  The Ella Fitzgerald Foundation, UCLA and BGCH share the cost of the program. 
BGCH
needs to raise $5,000 to maintain the program at its current level. 
 
All money raised will go
towards the program even if we don’t make our goal.  We have unique perks for your
contribution:  Anything up to $25 will
get you a personalized “Thank You” card designed and created by one of our music students; $26-$50
gets you the card plus a ticket to the annual concert at UCLA Schoenberg Hall
on May 27th;  $51-$75 in
addition to the first two, a star in the BGCH Clubhouse Music Room with your
name on it; $76-$100 will get you listed in the program booklet for the year
end concert plus the aforementioned items; $101-$250 will get you invited to the
dinner reception hosted by the music students after the annual concert plus the aforementioned perks.
 
Please get the word out
through Facebook, Twitter, Email, and Blogs. 
Help us give our youth the chance to enjoy the wonderful benefits of
music.  
 
 
The BGCH is a 501(c)(3) non profit organization and
all donations are tax deductible as provided by law.

story:
Our Story

We are a music private school in Crystal Lake Ill.    It was founded by Mrs. Villec who taught music in the public and private schools for many years, as well as private lessons.    It currently has 13 teachers and about 150 students.    We offer classes as well as private lessons for Voice, Piano, Guitar, Strings (including Harp), Woodwind, and Brass and Percussion.   We give the students much experience in performance as we put on at least 2 - 6 shows per year at no extra cost to them.   In addition, for the shows we pull together the private students to work on ensemble and band music in order to get much needed experience performing with other students.   Our teachers are of the highest quality, with degrees in music, music education, as well as exceptional professional performing experience.   

 

The economic crisis hit just as Music Maker's was taking off (we are in our 5th year).    The founder had quit her full time music job to devote all of her time to this school just before the crises.   At the same time, many students were forced to quit due to job losses in their families.   Some have still not been able to return.   We have lost many students over the last couple years due to the situation, and just lost a few more in the last couple weeks for the same reason.   It is an understatement to say that it is a miracle we've survived!   

 

But, we have been fortunate to pick up new students as well along the way,and even have had to move to a bigger unit.     Of course that means more rent, and hiring employees to answer phones and handle the schedule.   So while we've helped a few students continue at our cost, we can not afford to help any more than those few.  

 

 

 

 

 

We are a private music school in Crystal Lake Ill.    Crystal Lake is part of McHenry County, and near Cook County.   In general it is a middle class area.   We have wonderful public and private schools but most of them have cut or are in the process of cutting music programs.    Your funds would help us offer scholarships and aid to those students that can not afford lessons at this time! In most cases it would be a temporary situation; just until the parents find a job, or restructure their finances.    I will immediately call all the students we've lost the last couple years and offer them assistance for lessons   I will  also approach schools and ask if there are any students for whom music was their one saving grace in life, but it had been cut from the program.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to offer aid and start a foundation whereby local business can also contribute to the cause.   The funds will be used to pay the teachers for lessons for those students that are in need of lessons but  can not afford them.   We will give updates of specific cases where your money helped!    What you get:   the knowledge and satisfaction that you have helped change a child's life!   Once they can read music and play an instrument, they are more likely to go down a good path in life and stay out of trouble (check out the studies at our website).   They're more likely to do better in math, reading and science.   They're more likely to be happy, pursue their dreams, and become quality citizens in our society!     Actually, you'll be helping hundreds of children in this regard!    Check out our perks and Check us out at our website:  www.musicmakers4life.com and don't forget to click the link that shows a few of our past performances!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

story:
Latest Updates From The Expedition

  • Suunto Gives Direction to Team Sedna

  • Crossing the Arctic Circle via Snorkel

  • Girls with Robots: Empowering exploration through marine technology

  • A Mexican woman in the Arctic

  • Pelagic sea bird and marine mammal survey proves challenging for Team Sedna

  • Team Work Ensures Success

  • Team Sedna Expedition Update

  • -1.8 Degrees C Waters and Icebergs Travelling the Nain Coast

  • A Visit to the Deserted Outpost of Hebron, Labrador

  • Kids, Crabs & Cod: Exploring the sea life off the shores of Nain, Labrador

Short Summary

Pushing the limits of human endurance by snorkeling in unforgiving arctic waters requires lots of specialized gear—lots of dive gear, including safety equipment, which translates into epic excess baggage costs…

Our team of ten female explorers has recently returned from conducting a proof-of-concept expedition to Newfoundland, Labrador, Western Greenland and Iceland. During the past year, we raised 80 percent of our expedition costs. But, we still owe $50,000 for this expedition.

We’re raising global awareness about disappearing sea ice and ocean change in the Arctic, and we need your help to pay off our debt.

In July 10-27, 2014, the 2014-2016 Sedna Epic Expedition successfully ran its sea trials in arctic waters filled with pack ice and icebergs. Using diver propulsion vehicles and supported by the 116-foot MV Cape Race, we demonstrated that snorkelers can successfully ‘go the distance’ in coastal waters and in open waters more than 9,000 feet deep. Intent on firsts, we even snorkeled across the Arctic Circle!

We also conducted marine mammal and sea bird surveys during the expedition. Using a remotely operated vehicle and mobile touch aquariums, we brought the ocean ‘to eye level,’ delivering a hands-on ocean educational outreach program to the Inuit community of Nain, Labrador. In St. John’s, Newfoundland, we spoke to 49 young women, ages 16 and 17, about pursuing careers in science, exploration and movie making.

This proof-of-concept expedition is crucial to reaching our ultimate goal of snorkeling Canada’s Northwest Passage—all 3,000 kilometers of it—during the summer of 2016. We can’t achieve one without the other, so your support is essential to the success of both of our missions.

What We Need and What You Get

We need $50,000 to cover the final costs of our expedition for 2014.  That money covers the cost of the following:

  • Gear for snorkeling in arctic waters
  • Global rescue insurance
  • Freight costs for gear
  • Filming the expedition
  • Scientific equipment for outreach and education
  • Diver propulsion vehicles to scoot along with in the snorkel zone

The Impact

The impact of our all-female expedition is both local and global. During the expedition, we’re reaching out to the communities we visit. Simultaneously, we’re connecting to a global community who is supporting and following our international expedition. Immersing ourselves in the issue of disappearing sea ice, we’ll translate our findings into educational and awareness programs of ocean change.

The expedition will serve as a "call to action" for citizens of the world, including youth, providing aboriginal and scientific knowledge to inform governments of the world on implementing science-based policies to mitigate global warming. The expedition will also serve to inspire women and girls to think "big," and to follow their dreams, no matter how out-of-the box they may appear...

Providing educational and life role models, we’ll reach out to Inuit and Inuvialuit women and girls, empowering them to build resilient communities to mitigate the impacts of societal and climate change.


Other Ways You Can Help Team Sedna

  • Like us on Facebook and follow our journey in the snorkel zone.
  • Connect us to other organizations that might like to partner with us.
  • Connect us with sponsors who can back us during the 2014-2016 Sedna Epic Expedition.

Help make it happen for the 2014-2016 Sedna Epic Expedition’s ten sea women!

Team Sedna Perks Information

Thanks to donated equipment from our fantastic sponsors like Santi, Suunto, Aqualung and others. We are able to offer you the incredible perks you see on the right hand side, however Indiegogo does not allow us to show you the details on all the fantastic equipment we are offering. So please click to view detailed perk listings on the Sedna Epic website.

All merchandise perks will be shipped COD.


Team Sedna Sponsors & Partners

We are fortunate to have these great sponsors & partners supporting our expedition.

  • Santi - Extend Your Limits
  • Santi - Ladies First
  • Suunto
  • Halcyon
  • Nanuk
  • Arctic Kingdom
  • And many more

Below is Sirena Rising and Sedna's Reach limited edition digital artwork perks by Jill Heinerth.


Please visit our website sponsors & partners pages for a complete listing.

View detailed perk listings on the Team Sedna website

Help make it happen for the 2014-2016 Sedna Epic Expedition and its ten sea women!

story:
ABOUT THE EARTH CENTER

The Earth Center’s mission is to provide humanity with the tools necessary to reconnect with Kemetic traditions and spirituality.

The Earth Center is a multi-faceted not-for-profit corporation, with six existing schools functioning without funding from governments, corporations, or foundations. It is comprised of three branches: M’TAM School of Kemetic Philosophy and Spirituality, Ankhkasta Natural Healing and Firefly Productions. M’TAM School of Kemetic Philosophy and Spirituality offers the oldest initiatic science known to man and the most ancient knowledge this world can produce. Ankhkasta Natural Healing aims to reintroduce humanity to traditional forms of healing by providing alternatives to the modern world’s approach to health. Firefly Productions strives to educate people worldwide about traditional culture, spirituality and philosophy through various media publications which embrace the teachings of the Earth Center’s founder, Naba Lamoussa Morodenibig. 

WHY DOES THIS MATTER?

The current condition of humanity shows that a human without a cultural, philosophical, and spiritual education is just a human who hasn't even begun to exist. This condition began when well known ideologies set out to eradicate the knowledge that powers the civilisation of people designated by the term savage. But, humanity has no culture that is not linked to its past; so, to be dreaming of a world without a past is simply to be indulging imagination. Traditional initiation teaches that imagination can be lived only in a dream. The present condition of our world, a world where the individual is nothing other than a thing or a mere number, is one result, and leaders of the new world order are the ones responsible.

History reveals that in the 18th dynasty of the Pharaohs of Kemet, our political leaders started measuring their greatness by the territorial conquests they made, instead of by their spiritual qualities. History has shown that when a society turns its back on its people for material conquests, the society succumbs to psychological degeneration.  It then wavers between destruction of others and destruction of itself. Its children kill and commit suicide without any real emotion.

Power driven politics continue to be the link that connects this worldwide apparatus of destruction. Humanity has put up with this type of cruelty for over 2,000 years. We can easily observe the devastation as a result of shifting our interest from preserving life and human quality to achieving personal ambitions and material things.

What lessons does this have to offer us today?

In the past it was a cultural renaissance guided by the origins of spirituality that provided us an escape from our demise.  It can once again provide us that escape from the delusions of our leaders. As our Ancestors have said, “To get to where we want to go, we first must know where it is we are coming from.”  

Kemetic culture originated along the Nile valley and is the original source of humanity's spiritual education.  It is the same culture that  flourished  during the pharaonic era and gave rise to humanity's greatest achievements, almost all of which remain an enigma to the world.  This culture is the foundation on which humanity's ancestors established the most highly evolved and longest lasting civilisation humanity has seen.  This culture is based on Divine principles that place the rise of human quality above all else and guarantees one’s success in achieving perfect harmony with the existence, through preservation of life and the Earth, which sustains us.  Through these principles we honor and recognise the order of Gods and humans.  As we strive to emulate the purity/perfection we see in the Divine World.  

The decaying state of our modern society compelled Dogon High Priest & Kemetic Prophet, NEB Naba Lamoussa Morodenibig, to spearhead a movement to return humanity to its original culture. He founded The Earth Center as a path to this ancient but living Kemetic knowledge.  

WHAT WE NEED

This is where you come in! We need your support to raise $35,000 to assist in the foundation of the first Earth Center school in Europe. 

The people of the UK who are realising that this movement is the solution that humanity has been searching for, have decided to bring The Earth Center onto British soil. 

This seed money will fund the basic operations and accommodations while this new location gains its self sufficiency:

  • School & Office Equipment

  • Furnishings

  • Travel & Lodging Expenses 

  • Rent & Utility Expenses for the first 6 months

Benefit humanity and yourself by taking advantage of one or more of our perks! Gain ancestral wisdom from initiatic stories, reconnect with Kemetic philosophy, or improve your physical and spiritual health through herbs and readings.

YOUR IMPACT

Your contribution will help to forge the mission ahead. No longer can we continue to sit and watch this destruction of civilisation; we must rise and rebuild the world we want to see. Let’s re-educate ourselves and return to the  culture that sustained humanity for hundreds of thousands of years. Instead of discussing the state of the world, let’s join forces and do something about it.  

The United Kingdom school will provide a hub of cultural activity and learning for those seeking traditional knowledge.  This center will also provide the United Kingdom community access to a network of traditional healers and natural herbs that have sustained humanity throughout history.

Finally! Those looking to reconnect spiritually with Kemetic culture will have the chance to set out on the path of authentic initiation and be reunited with the original code of human behaviour that set the Ancestors of humanity on a constant quest towards quality.  This phenomenal path has been paved by masters of the preservation of life since the origins of human culture.  

Elders, men, women and children will all be reconnected and fortified through Kemetic values.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Perhaps you are not able to make a contribution to this cause. You can help in other ways. Let your friends and family know about our goal and get them involved by sharing a link to this campaign, posting it on your Facebook page, and tweeting about it. The more who know about this campaign, the better. Like our page on Facebook and join our mailing list.


INCENTIVE DETAILS         

FREE SHIPPING ON ALL ORDERS!

All incentives will be shipped after the campaign ends. 

All orders will include tracking information which will be emailed to you. For non-U.S. incentives, please allow 1-2 weeks for delivery. Please allow an extra 4-5 days for poster delivery (domestic and international locations).

DISCLAIMER: The Earth Center is not responsible for any lost packages. If your package is lost in the mail, please contact The Earth Center at firefly@theearthcenter.com.

For more detailed information on the incentive items please visit us at www.theearthcenter.org


INITIATE PACKAGE



ANCESTRAL PACKAGE



ANKH PACKAGE

Those looking to reconnect spiritually with Kemetic culture will have the chance to set out on the path of authentic initiation and be reunited with the original code of human behaviour that set the Ancestors of humanity on a constant quest towards quality.  This phenomenal path has been paved by masters of the preservation of life since the origins of human culture.  Elders, men, women and children will all be reconnected and fortified through Kemetic values.OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPPerhaps you are not able to make a contribution to this cause. You can help in other ways. Let your friends and family know about our goal and get them involved by sharing a link to this campaign, posting it on your Facebook page, and tweeting about it. The more who know about this campaign, the better. Like our page on Facebook and join our mailing list.
INCENTIVE DETAILS         
FREE SHIPPING ON ALL ORDERS!All incentives will be shipped after the campaign ends. All orders will include tracking information which will be emailed to you. For non-U.S. incentives, please allow 1-2 weeks for delivery. Please allow an extra 4-5 days for poster delivery (domestic and international locations).DISCLAIMER: The Earth Center is not responsible for any lost packages. If your package is lost in the mail, please contact The Earth Center at firefly@theearthcenter.com.For more detailed information on the incentive items please visit us at www.theearthcenter.orgINITIATE PACKAGEANCESTRAL PACKAGEANKH PACKAGE

story:
Short Summary

This camp is named in honor of Mrs. Jessica Lawrence, a longtime resident of East Lake Courts, who started the camp many years ago as a way to create a safe and fun place for kids to go during summer break. The camp is held at the recreation center in East Lake Courts and is open FREE OF CHARGE to community children.

Camp will start on May 27 and will run Tuesday through Friday from 9AM-5PM until August 5. The camp will serve approximately 25 children from the ages of 5-11. A healthy breakfast, lunch and snack will be provided daily with the help of the YMCA Summer Feeding Program.

The East Lake Courts recreation center has a fully stocked children's library and the children will spend time each week strengthening their writing, reading, and math skills. Additionally, the children will participate in several activity blocks which will include arts and crafts, theater and performance, cultural heritage, and community gardening. The children will also go on several field trips throughout the summer.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise AT LEAST $1000 by the beginning of summer camp. This money will primarily be spent on creating several memorable field trips. Last year, because of donations from people like you, we were able to raise enough to go to the movie theater,  the East Lake Park ("Duck Pond"), the Nature Center, the Creative Discovery Museum, Coolidge Park, and Lake Winnie. We would love to be able to repeat some of these trips this year. We are most excited about adding a trip to Atlanta which will focus on the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. and the civil rights history of the area. The funds will also help to purchase supplies that keep a summer camp functioning (markers, paper, glue, music, etc.).

It only takes 20 people donating $50 to meet our goal! That's only $5 per week that summer camp will be operating. What do you spend $50 on over the course of 10 weeks? What would that $50 mean to one of the children who participates in camp this year?

The Impact

For many families in low-income communities, affordable and accessible summer camp options are very limited.  Mrs. Lawrence's East Lake Summer Camp provides a fun, safe, and educational option for children and their families. It is a no-cost resource for this neighborhood and it helps to create a space for focused and positive activity for community children.

Additionally, East Lake community is situated within one of the many food deserts within Chattanooga, meaning that access to groceries and particularly to fresh and healthy food options is minimal. Families who participate in Mrs. Lawrence's camps know they are able to rely on the breakfast and lunch provided as a source of nutrition throughout the long summer months. 

What memories do you have of your childhood summers? What lessons did you learn through summer camps that you participated in? What friendships did you build during those three months? What memories, lessons, and friendships will you help to nurture for these children?

Volunteer! 

The camp needs volunteers in 3 hour blocks of time. In the amount of time it takes to go and watch one movie a week, you could develop a relationship with a child that may impact the course of their life - or yours! If you can help or if your church or civic group is interested, please contact Mrs. Jessica Lawrence at 423-260-3626.

story:
Summary

Ink* is founded by three leaders in education around the world. Based upon the principle that getting ahead in life should not just be for those who are ahead in life, our leaders have already created three (yes three!) charter schools around the world.

 

Ok, But Really, What is Ink*?

There are 3 main components to Ink*-

(1) Our online educational platform- this platform, with its proprietary bank of test questions, will help students better understand their strengths and weaknesses within particular subjects.

(2) Our network of Ink* certified instructors- Currently, there is no way for a struggling parent to know whether the after school tutor she sends her child to is amazing or amazingly bad. Ink* is going to change all through. Through our certification process, parents will now have a clear signal about any particular instructor's qualifications.

(3) Our unique training curriculum- All Ink* schools will have access to our different curriculum, which includes online tutorials and in-class training sessions. These materials are generated from leaders within the education industry and have been proven to be successful.

What We Need & What You Get

What do we need? It's simple. $25,000 will allow us to build out adaptive software platform. This platform will help us to create an intimate learning environment for those students who use it. 

We are also working with teachers around the world to develop better lesson plans that not just teach concepts, but apply those concepts in the real world.

The Impact

Have you ever looked around at a particular problem and known how to fix it, but just didn't know where to start?

Start Here.

You can be confident that supporting our project will pay off.

We have a proven track record of effective projects. We opened our first school back in 2004. Since then, our original school has had two more building levels added on. And by the end of this summer, we will be opening two more schools around the world. We know education.

And we are looking for people who can be hands-on with us. Not just contributing money, but also ideas, thoughts, man (or woman!) hours. Let's make this movement work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support for Ink* doesn't need to stop here. 

We are also looking for volunteers to help us get out the message about this project. Please spread the word and get others to donate, volunteer, or just provide us words of encouragement!

Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Holly Adams, and I am a performer, playwright, teaching artist, loving wife and mother of two, living in the Fingerlakes region of New York State. 

I believe that art is how we really connect to, process and understand our world, each other, our communities, our learning, our living, our dying; art has the power to make us think and make us invest emotionally, and my Masters degree is in Theatre, Education, and Social Change (there's a shocker, right?). I have tacked a longer bio onto the end, if you'd like to know more about me, and you could also go to my website http://shearwaterproductions.com if you would like to.

My Campaign:  This year, I have the honor of returning to Afghanistan with one of the board members of Afghan Friends Network  (http://afghanfriends.net), a nonprofit delivering sustainable programs in education and cultural exchange that nurture potential, promote dignity, and support bold steps in Afghanistan. We will also meet with key stakeholders to learn what's needed next, and what we can do from North America as well. In addition, as the Artist-in-Residence at SUNY's Empire State College, I am working with the Center for Distance Learning and the Graduate Studies and Community Learning programs to develop opportunities for Afghan women to have access to university studies not available to them in Afghanistan.

I am also honored with the opportunity of doing some work with the Mobile Mini Circus for Children! YAY! They are incredible and inspiring, and you can learn more about them here: http://www.afghanmmcc.org

Video footage from the trip in 2002 is from the film made of that trip, "Clown in Kabul" by Stefano Moser, and photos of that journey are mostly by Lorenzo Franzi, who gave me permission to use his pictures for educational and outreach purposes.

What I Need & What You Get

Costs for 10-12 day trip: 

Plane fare. Currently listed at just over $2,500 to $4000, depending on the airline and availability.

Lodging. Eva Vander Giessen estimates $800 - $1000.

Local Transportation. Estimated at $15/day, so $150 - $180.

VISA. $160

Vaccinations and Vaccination Visit. $275

Food. $300

Tips. $150

Travel Insurance. $175

Gifts and Supplies (for Circus Children and Educators). $250

If I don't reach my whole goal, I will continue to pursue avenues for funding. I am determined to go.

PERKS

Everybody who even contributes a like or a hug will get an emailed digital photo signed by some of the people I will be working with. Indiegogo wouldn't let me write that in, so I wrote $1.

People who contribute $10-$25 will get a digital copy of a photo/writing journal that will include words and pix by Afghans.

People who contribute $25-$50 will also receive a print of the picture of their choice.

People who contribute $50-$150 will also receive a digital copy of the multi-media (including audio and video portions) journal created by people I will be working with and myself.

People who contribute $150-$250 will also receive a dvd of the multi-media journal that ALSO includes special features!!!!

People who contribute more than $250 --- I will also make you a mask, and send you chocolate!

The Impact

I have had the opportunity to participate in other projects overseas, especially in impoverished areas, that focused on healing, education, and community. It has been my experience that in addition to the concrete actions and accomplishments, the impact of the support itself is powerful. Sometimes, having people come and be deeply emotionally invested in your project and work to help you accomplish your goals nourishes the soul so that you can keep fighting the good fight, so to speak.  I have also learned that when I return home and share with students, educators, community members and so on, I foster a change in perspective. One more small grain of peace.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share, forward, like....whatever happens, at least we've spent a moment rooting for these women and educators!

  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Many many thanks to Thomas Hoebbel Video-Photo, who has already helped by putting together my video, http://www.youtube.com/user/TomHoebbel

And that’s all there is to it.

REALLY LONG BIO, if you are interested

A professional performer, playwright, and teaching artist for the past 25 years, Holly particularly enjoys creating and performing original work: she creates new work annually with physical theatre company Kakeru, toured VOICES/lives with co-creator and performer Pete Rush, and starred in the Off-Broadway production The Oral Tradition, written with collaborator David A. Miller from Roundabout Theatre.Other favorites include Love, Loss and What I Wore, My Father's Dragon, A Midsummer Night's Dream, Macbeth, Further Adventures of Clown, NYC/CNY tour of VOICES/lives, The Oral Tradition Off –Broadway, Richard III in Kynge’s Games, Summers at Rock’s Edge at the Kitchen Theatre, Netta (leading lady) in the film In the Bag, and audiobooks with Audible Inc and Full Cast Audio. She also loves Red Nose work, which takes her to lots of places on planet earth! She is the primary writer for Mystery & Adventure Agency, and her plays are performed across NYS. Http://shearwaterproductions.com

Holly Adams' work as an artist in residence for schools and universities links academic and arts curricula, as well as addressing social and cultural challenges. Holly taught in Connecticut's "Fame School", the Greater Hartford Academy of Performing Arts, before moving to Tompkins County. She has since been an artist in residence for 15 years of NYSCA's Empire State Partnership programs, and has taught at colleges, performing arts schools, and k-12 schools across the state. Holly has given professional development workshops in conjunction with NYS Alliance for Arts Education, NYS Council on the Arts, the Community Arts Partnership, NYS Theatre Education Association, in British Columbia, and for various theater companies. She was Assistant Director and Director of the Performance Department of the Mental Health Association of the Southern Tier for eight years. Holly’s dedication to arts as healing fuels her work as a Clown Therapist and consultant/trainer for Clown Therapy programs around the world.

Holly is a graduate of the Dell 'Arte School of Physical Theater, and holds a Masters degree in Theatre, Education, and Social Change. She is also the 2009-2010 recipient of the Association of Teaching Artist’s Teaching Artist Service to the Field Award.

story:
My name is, Nyoka Anderson, and I am a 15 year old high school sophomore  Arlington, Texas. 

 Being a sophomore in High School, this is a privilege to be nominated and this is a program that enables me to learn more about the Field of Medicine which is my lifetime goal, to become a doctor.  I am still researching which type of doctor I want to become, and I know this opportunity will award me more information to make a decision. 

 I am reaching out to all of my family, and friends to help me get there.  I will be attending the Forum on Medicine, July 21st -30th, 2013, in New York, New York.  During my stay in New York I will be staying on the campus of St. John’s University. I will obtain 2 college credits for attending this Forum, and the wealth of knowledge that I will obtain while there is priceless.        

 I would appreciate any size of donation to help me reach my goal of $500.00, to help me with my tuition payments for the program.  Although this is a great opportunity, it is quite an expense for my parents.  I am really excited about this opportunity, but know that I had to do my part and be creative in getting sponsors and donations.  No amount is too small, as I will use all donations to pay my tuition, travel, and personal expenses while in New York.

 Thank you in advance and I am really excited about this opportunity!

 Sincerely,

 Nyoka Anderson

story:
DAILY UPDATE:

We just added this bracelet to our donation incentive list.  For anyone who donates $25 or more.  We will mail you one of these bracelets.  Thanks again for donating!

Blessings,

Tom

 

 

ABOUT THE DESTROY ILLUSIONS SCHOOL ASSEMBLY

 

 

The Destroy Illusions Anti-Bullying Program was founded 6 years ago by Tom "The Illusionist" Coverly.  Tom is an international youth speaker, comedian and illusionist.  He has shared the stage with numerous big names in music, entertained celebrities in NY and Hollywood, seen on TV and has been working with teenagers for over 20 years both as a former youth minister and public speaker.

  • In the past 5 years alone, Tom has performed and spoken to over 1 million young people with his powerful life-changing story in 4 countries and 40 states.
  • We want to reach even more youth in this world with this assembly. After each assembly, students are lined up to speak to Tom.  Thousands of emails pour in each year with students sharing their stories of how the school assembly has transformed and saved their life from destruction.
  • There are not to many school assemblies that tackle the tough issues of bullying, suicide, cutting, etc in a "cool" modern way that impact middle and high school students long after the assembly is over! 
  • Students need YOU!  They are presented with LIES and ILLUSIONS everyday thru media, TV, social media and the bullies around them.  This assembly uses illusions and comedy to break their walls down, using deception to talk about deceptions of life.  Then, when it comes time for Tom's powerful story and message, you can hear a pin drop in the room as Tom combats the ILLUSIONS in this world they have believed about themselves with the TRUTH and REALITY about themselves!   Tom's in-your-face talks are captivating students to the point of change not just for one day, but for the rest of the school year and best of all ... the rest of their lives.

HOW CAN YOU HELP?  

There is no price tag for someones life!  Your generous donation can play a huge role in saving a kid from tragically ending his/her life!  The #1 cause of death among kids 10-14 years old is SUICIDE.  Often times, these students end their lives short due to being bullied!  The more schools we can continue to speak to around the world, the more lives will be saved and touched by this poweful assembly.  

              YOU can make a difference!

 

 

WHAT DO WE NEED?

 

 

Suicide and Bullying are a serious epidemic facing kids.  It's no surprise, if you turn on the TV and watch the news, our schools have become war zones with school shootings and violence.  Why waste this incredible illusion on entertaining people on a stage in Vegas, when one of the best illusions of all time can be impacting and saving lives in schools!!!  We realize this illusion is a lot of money.  Our vision to reach this generation is HUGE and we need an army of people who are willing to invest in something bigger than ourselves.  

Remember back to your middle and high school days when something "cool" caught your attention and made your eyes and ears perk up.  We know this unique illusion will capture the attention of the youth and create curiosity for students and administrators wanting to see this illusion performed live.  More importantly, we believe this illusion will create the perfect object lesson to coincide with our powerful life-changing message on anti-bullying and other related topics like suicide, cutting etc.  Every penny donated generously by you will help us include this amazing illusion into the assembly beginning as early as the fall of 2017!  

 

 

 

 

WHAT IS THE SCORPION ILLUSION? 

It is a new illusion that is 12' long, 12' tall and 8' wide.  It is completely mechanical with moving parts and operated wirelessly by a stage assistant.  Tom climbs inside of the body of the scorpion and gets restrained with leg shackles and his arms locked in cuffs.  The blade on the tail of the Scorpion begins to slowly move down toward the slit in the metal body frame.  The blade comes down and saws into the body of the scorpion.  All of a sudden, the metal body opens up revealing Tom has vanished.  Where is he?  Well, Tom in a split second appears in the back of the auditorium behind all the students.  We honestly believe, Tom's school assembly is one of the best around because of his heart, passion and life-changing message.  This illusion can change even more lives!  It's the perfect object lesson that will be remembered forever.  It ties in perfectly with Tom's talk on destroying the illusions students believe about bullying and life. 

 

OUR GOAL:  $35,000+ !!!

 

 

What happens if we do NOT reach our goal?

Any monies raised will 100% go towards providing FREE school assemblies for low income schools around the world that would not normally be able to host a school assembly.  

What happens if OVER $35,000 is raised?  

Can you imagine raising OVER $35,000 or $75,000 or better yet, over $100,000?  We would be able to purchase this amazing illusion AND provide hundreds of FREE school assemblies to low income schools.  We will provide 1 free school assembly per every $1500 over our goal of $35,000.  That means, more lives saved and changed in neighborhoods that need it most!  There are many schools who contact us that cannot afford to host an assembly.  Donations raised above our goal, now make it possible!  

 

THE PERKS - WHAT DO YOU GET?

We have listed all kinds of great ways to thank you for your generous donations.  Feel free to enjoy the perks as our thank you for your generous financial gift.  The ultimate perk is knowing your donation WILL change lives forever!    

To read more about our school assembly, please go to www.destroyillusions.com.

 

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP?

Please help us by talking about this fundraising campaign with everyone you know.  Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, etc!  Thank YOU so much for caring enough about today's youth!  Together, we WILL make a difference.

Many blessings,

Tom Coverly

www.DestroyIllusions.com 

www.facebook.com/officialtcti
story_txt:
DAILY UPDATE:We just added this bracelet to our donation incentive list.  For anyone who donates $25 or more.  We will mail you one of these bracelets.  Thanks again for donating!Blessings, Tom  ABOUT THE DESTROY ILLUSIONS SCHOOL ASSEMBLY  The Destroy Illusions Anti-Bullying Program was founded 6 years ago by Tom "The Illusionist" Coverly.  Tom is an international youth speaker, comedian and illusionist.  He has shared the stage with numerous big names in music, entertained celebrities in NY and Hollywood, seen on TV and has been working with teenagers for over 20 years both as a former youth minister and public speaker.
In the past 5 years alone, Tom has performed and spoken to over 1 million young people with his powerful life-changing story in 4 countries and 40 states.
We want to reach even more youth in this world with this assembly. After each assembly, students are lined up to speak to Tom.  Thousands of emails pour in each year with students sharing their stories of how the school assembly has transformed and saved their life from destruction.
There are not to many school assemblies that tackle the tough issues of bullying, suicide, cutting, etc in a "cool" modern way that impact middle and high school students long after the assembly is over! 
Students need YOU!  They are presented with LIES and ILLUSIONS everyday thru media, TV, social media and the bullies around them.  This assembly uses illusions and comedy to break their walls down, using deception to talk about deceptions of life.  Then, when it comes time for Tom's powerful story and message, you can hear a pin drop in the room as Tom combats the ILLUSIONS in this world they have believed about themselves with the TRUTH and REALITY about themselves!   Tom's in-your-face talks are captivating students to the point of change not just for one day, but for the rest of the school year and best of all ... the rest of their lives.
HOW CAN YOU HELP?  There is no price tag for someones life!  Your generous donation can play a huge role in saving a kid from tragically ending his/her life!  The #1 cause of death among kids 10-14 years old is SUICIDE.  Often times, these students end their lives short due to being bullied!  The more schools we can continue to speak to around the world, the more lives will be saved and touched by this poweful assembly.                YOU can make a difference!  WHAT DO WE NEED?  Suicide and Bullying are a serious epidemic facing kids.  It's no surprise, if you turn on the TV and watch the news, our schools have become war zones with school shootings and violence.  Why waste this incredible illusion on entertaining people on a stage in Vegas, when one of the best illusions of all time can be impacting and saving lives in schools!!!  We realize this illusion is a lot of money.  Our vision to reach this generation is HUGE and we need an army of people who are willing to invest in something bigger than ourselves.  Remember back to your middle and high school days when something "cool" caught your attention and made your eyes and ears perk up.  We know this unique illusion will capture the attention of the youth and create curiosity for students and administrators wanting to see this illusion performed live.  More importantly, we believe this illusion will create the perfect object lesson to coincide with our powerful life-changing message on anti-bullying and other related topics like suicide, cutting etc.  Every penny donated generously by you will help us include this amazing illusion into the assembly beginning as early as the fall of 2017!      WHAT IS THE SCORPION ILLUSION? It is a new illusion that is 12' long, 12' tall and 8' wide.  It is completely mechanical with moving parts and operated wirelessly by a stage assistant.  Tom climbs inside of the body of the scorpion and gets restrained with leg shackles and his arms locked in cuffs.  The blade on the tail of the Scorpion begins to slowly move down toward the slit in the metal body frame.  The blade comes down and saws into the body of the scorpion.  All of a sudden, the metal body opens up revealing Tom has vanished.  Where is he?  Well, Tom in a split second appears in the back of the auditorium behind all the students.  We honestly believe, Tom's school assembly is one of the best around because of his heart, passion and life-changing message.  This illusion can change even more lives!  It's the perfect object lesson that will be remembered forever.  It ties in perfectly with Tom's talk on destroying the illusions students believe about bullying and life.  OUR GOAL:  $35,000+ !!!  What happens if we do NOT reach our goal?Any monies raised will 100% go towards providing FREE school assemblies for low income schools around the world that would not normally be able to host a school assembly.  What happens if OVER $35,000 is raised?  Can you imagine raising OVER $35,000 or $75,000 or better yet, over $100,000?  We would be able to purchase this amazing illusion AND provide hundreds of FREE school assemblies to low income schools.  We will provide 1 free school assembly per every $1500 over our goal of $35,000.  That means, more lives saved and changed in neighborhoods that need it most!  There are many schools who contact us that cannot afford to host an assembly.  Donations raised above our goal, now make it possible!   THE PERKS - WHAT DO YOU GET?We have listed all kinds of great ways to thank you for your generous donations.  Feel free to enjoy the perks as our thank you for your generous financial gift.  The ultimate perk is knowing your donation WILL change lives forever!    To read more about our school assembly, please go to www.destroyillusions.com.   OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP?Please help us by talking about this fundraising campaign with everyone you know.  Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, etc!  Thank YOU so much for caring enough about today's youth!  Together, we WILL make a difference.Many blessings,Tom Coverlywww.DestroyIllusions.com www.facebook.com/officialtcti

story:
MAN Keboan is an Islamic public school in Jombang, Indonesia. Last year 10% of the graduating class (125 students) entered university. The reason for this low figure is due to the poverty in this area. University is unaffordable for almost all of the students at MAN Keboan, thus a scholarship is required for them to attend college. Unfortunately, most schools charge a registration fee just for students to take this test. In an area where many families only earn around $2 USD per day, finding the $25 USD needed to pay the registration fee is not possible for many.

 

By donating to this project you will be helping a student have a chance at a college education. Your donation will cover their test registration fee ($25-$30) as well as their transportation by bus to the test ($2-$5 roundtrip).

 

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Elementary school students at Public School 20 in Brooklyn have created a book of poetry and art: "Look into the Sky, You'll See Me Running."
We plan to print and sell 300 copies of the book to raise funds and awareness for two
organizations: Room to Read, an international nonprofit that focuses on literacy and gender equality in education, and The Valentino Achak Deng Foundation, a nonprofit that provides secondary education in South Sudan, with a special focus on girls.
McNally Jackson self publishing is giving us a deal, we just need to raise funds to cover printing and shipping. Any extra money raised here will also go to the nonprofits!
The kids at PS20 have created some really great work. And they are very excited at the prospect of their work being published and the money they raise going to help other kids!
Yay!

story:
Our Story

We are embarking on a charitable vehicle rally race (August 15-31) through Eastern Europe and Central Asia, benefiting an orphanage in Armenia. The route and the terrain through the Caucus mountains will be grueling, but the positive effects will be long-lasting and highly rewarding.


See the race website and our team website for more information. 

  • The 2011 Caucasian Challenge
  • Arabian Knights team website


We have also created Facebook and Twitter pages to make it easy to track our progress!

  • Arabian Knights Facebook page
  • Twitter page - @3arabianknights

 

The Impact

Your sponsorship will help provide educational, internet-ready rugged laptops to needy orphan children in Armenia. We are working together with One Laptop per Child (OLPC), whose mission is "to empower the children in developing countries to learn by providing one connected laptop to every school-age child".


What We Need

We need your support, love and donations!  100% of the money donated will go towards the charity.  Any money left over from the laptops will be given to the orphanage for clothing, food, supplies, etc.


If you are unable to donate, you can still help by spreading the word about our cause.  Tell your friends and family about it, forward our emails, connect with us on Facebook or just follow along once the race begins!

 

What You Get

Our love and adoration!  Being that we're putting everything into the charity, we can't offer much, but everyone who donates will receive a personal thank you note and/or personalized post cards from the our time at the orphanage and on the road.  Warm, fuzzy feelings come standard with each donation!


Who Are We

We are three English teachers currently loving life in Saudi Arabia.

  • Trent Hagar is a world traveler from Texas and a hard-core, wanna-be photographer! His travel blog can be found at http://www.travelpod.com/members/trent

  • Art Rich is our experienced Californian rally racer who last competed in the Southern Indian Auto-Rickshaw Charity Challenge in 2008!

  • Andy Conder is from England (but we're letting him tag along anyways) and is currently the Secretary to the FIA Stewards of the Saudi Arabian Motor Federation!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone! My name is Karen and I am currently a social work student at the University of Utah. I will be graduating with my Masters this August...woohoo!
 
Before graduating, I must complete a practicum placement where I volunteer my expertise to an agency in order to gain real life social work experience. As a social worker with strong interests in global social welfare, I felt it was important for me to gain international experience. I applied and have been accepted to go to wonderful program in Kerala, India where I will be working with children who have been separated from their families because either one or both of their parents are in prison.
 
This agency is the only of its kind in India and they run an amazing program! All the children live on site at the agency either because their extended families do no want them or cannot afford to provide for them. The agency sees to all aspects of the childrens development including education, skills development, mentoring, and therapy in addition to a home environment.
 
During my three months of work, I will be utilizing a number of expressive therapy techniques (such as dance therapy and art therapy) to work with the children to help develop self-efficacy and self-esteem.
 
Completing my practicum in Kerela will afford me the opportunity to engage in a cross-cultural exchange of ideas which I can then bring back to my own community. The knowledge I will gain from this experience will be invaluable in shaping the social worker I will become and the work I will do.
 
Donations of ANY amount are greatly appreciated. Thank you so much!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that money is a scarce resource these days and I understand that some of you may not be able to contribute monetarily, but you can still help make this happen! I would be so appreciative if you could help spread the word about my campaign through whatever networks you feel would be appropriate. Thank you so much!

story:
View Original Presentation on Prezi:

http://prezi.com/jkxgx6p78mil/mt-kiliclimb/

 

 

Where Will the Money Go?

One housing unit is $7000. If we raise $7000 or less, 100% of those funds will go toward building the very first housing unit for the orphans.

If we raise more than $7000, we will use the excess to cover Autumn & Christina's expenses for the climb (park fees, hiring guides, renting equipment, etc). This excludes our airticket. That already came out of our own pocket. 

After the $7000 for the first housing unit + our climbing expenses, all other funds will go towards GHM and the 2nd housing unit...then the 3rd...then the 4th...and so on.

* As you very well know, exact figures/plans may change because of, well, life and its charming habit of giving us unpredictable circumstances. Whatever surprises may come our way, be rest assured, at the end of the campaign/climb, we will send you a financial report telling you exactly where your funds were allocated. 

 

 

Give Once And It Will Last Forever (theoretically)

It's simple: GHM pledges to use funds wisely and appropriately. GHM school will teach 300 students. Tuition from 150 village students will pay for the school and the orphanage. This means 150 orphans will receive free education, housing, food, and loving care. 

To get to this point, GHM actually needs BUILDINGS. They've already built one school and classes are already in session. GHM as an organization is still on "Phase One" of their building project. They are raising funds to build additional school buildings. We are working ahead to fund "Phase Two," which is building housing units for the orphans. We are raising 15 housing units for 150 orphans. Let's get these buildings up! Once the buildings are up, the tuition from the students should take care of the rest. 

 

 

About the Friends 

Christina & Autumn graduated together in 2012 from Valley Forge Christian College with degrees in Intercultural Studies. 

Africa changed us in a much needed way. It shifted our perspective on what we thought of happiness, wealth, and...well, how we wish to spend our lives. Overall, our career paths/futures have been changed by what we saw and learned. We want to live in a such a way that enable others to live more fully. 

Autumn will live in Busia and work with GHM for 7 months (September-March). Christina will do the same for 6 weeks (September-October). We've already bought our plane tickets and are SO excited to meet the students. Please note: Your contribution will not go towards our plane tickets or living expenses. If we raise more than $7000, your contribution will go toward the KiliClimb. 

 

 

Give Hope Ministries

GHM is a registered nonprofit with the IRS. You will receive a tax-deductible receipt for all your contributions. We are connected to this organization and believe in its model of self-sustainability. Find out more about this ministry: givehopeminisries.org

story:
Short Summary

The Institute for the Management of Conflict is focused with assisting Afghan communities in the construction of new schools for both boys and girls.  In addition, your contributions will help with repairing old structures that do not provide adequate shelter for its students.  

As international security forces depart Afghanistan, the creation of social stability for the Afghan people and its future leaders is paramount.  The education system in Afghanistan needs your help with creating a new beginning for its people.

Our organization is comprised of former special forces members who understand capacity building and its contributions to improving the lives of the local populace.  We are dedicated to mitigating conflict through community empowerment and development.  This project provides an avenue to peace.  More importantly it provides access to education.  Our team of professionals intend on returning to Afghanistan in a humanitarian capacity and will focus 100% of your donations to Afghanistan's education system.

What is needed:

TYPICAL COST OF SCHOOL PROJECTS IN URUZGAN PROVINCE AFGHANISTAN HAVE BEEN (cost is in US dollars):

- Land costs:  $0.00 (land belongs to the district governments)

- Water Well: $4,500 

- 8 Classroom Modules (20-student capacity classrooms):  $25,000

- Labor costs: (10 community members at $50.00 daily x 30-days for each project): $15,000

- 8 Educators ($150-monthly stipend for two-years $28,800) 

Total costs: $73,300 per school

Cost of building 8-sites is $586,400.

 

 OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

- Please spread the word about this campaign.  

- We are always looking for qualified volunteers to help in any capacity.

The Impact

Afghanistan has been subject to decades of war leading to its socio-political unrest.  With an almost non-existent education system pre-September 11, 2001, Afghanistan had one of the weakest systems of education in the world.  Through education, the Afghan people will repair, rebuild and create self-sustainment.  Another important endeavor with this project is creating the opportunity for girls to attend school throughout the country.

 

Find us on facebook at:  Institute for the Management of Conflict or at our website: villagesolidarity.org

story:
Hi, I'm Veronica, a current student at Southern Illinois University pursuing a career as a pediatric physician, and I'm happy to say I've been accepted to Indiana University School of Medicine.  I'm really excited because this ss one of my top choices.  In order for me to get my transcripts and fully enroll at Indiana University, I must finish paying off my fees at SIU.  I'm asking if you can help me reach my goal of $800.00 to finish paying off my fees and get my transcripts.  

 

Order of events:

 

Reach Goal --> Get Transcripts --> Go to Indiana --> Become a Doctor --> Give back to my community by treating sick kids

 

Help me fulfill my dream to go to med school.

 

SPREAD THE WORD!!!

 

And remember to choose a perk if you want :)

story:
Our Story

Sebastian is currently attending Le Cordon Bleu Chef school in Seattle.  This is her third 6-week term and she's doing really well - very close to the top of her class!  Sebastian got a partial scholarship and loans for tuition, but needs help with living expenses as she studies for school and cares for her 2-1/2 year old granddaughter, Malia. She's tried to get another loan, and had a co-signer with excellent credit but she was still denied.  We think it is because she is an ex-offender.  Please help Sebastian finish school by supporting our campaign! The total amount we need is $9,000 but we're starting out with $5,000.  Sebastian has been a leader in the ex-offender community by working with Keeping the Faith/The Prison Project and going back into the prison where she was incarcerated. She continues to inspire many women still in prison by having strong goals and working in the community. For donating, we prefer PayPal, but if you don't have a PayPal account, you can use your debit/credit card. Thank you!


The Impact

If we don't raise this money, Sebastian may have to quit school.


What We Need & What You Get

The funds we raise on this site will go directly to costs related to school, supplies, and, most importantly, study time for Sebastian to continue getting great grades in school.  The stress of not having enough funds to live and take care of her granddaughter weigh heavily on her, although she is very upbeat on a daily basis.  There are some wonderful perks! For $10 you get a graduation photo of Sebastian, for $100 you get a cobalt-blue mug from Le Cordon Bleu, and for $500 you get a sit-down dinner for up to 6 people prepared by the newly graduated 'Chef Sebastian!'  Any amount of donation is deeply appreciated!  All donations to Sebastian's School Campaign are tax-deductible through the Pat Graney Company, a non-profit organization.  For donating, we prefer PayPal, but if you don't have a PayPal account, you can use your debit/credit card. Thank you!


Other Ways You Can Help

You can send this notice to everyone you know, and post it to your facebook page and other community event pages.  Thank you!!!!!

The total amount we need is $9,000 but we're starting out with $5,000.  Sebastian has been a leader in the ex-offender community by working with Keeping the Faith/The Prison Project and going back into the prison where she was incarcerated. She continues to inspire many women still in prison by having strong goals and working in the community. For donating, we prefer PayPal, but if you don't have a PayPal account, you can use your debit/credit card. Thank you!


The Impact
If we don't raise this money, Sebastian may have to quit school.


What We Need & What You Get
The funds we raise on this site will go directly to costs related to school, supplies, and, most importantly, study time for Sebastian to continue getting great grades in school.  The stress of not having enough funds to live and take care of her granddaughter weigh heavily on her, although she is very upbeat on a daily basis.  There are some wonderful perks! For $10 you get a graduation photo of Sebastian, for $100 you get a cobalt-blue mug from Le Cordon Bleu, and for $500 you get a sit-down dinner for up to 6 people prepared by the newly graduated 'Chef Sebastian!'  Any amount of donation is deeply appreciated!  All donations to Sebastian's School Campaign are tax-deductible through the Pat Graney Company, a non-profit organization.  For donating, we prefer PayPal, but if you don't have a PayPal account, you can use your debit/credit card. Thank you!


Other Ways You Can Help
You can send this notice to everyone you know, and post it to your facebook page and other community event pages.  Thank you!!!!!

story:
StartupDesk was created by scratching our own itch!!

We are experienced, early stage technology folks who have come upon the problem of needing desks/workstations for developers, designers and other team members for our companies.  Typical office workstation solutions lack soul and are exorbitantly expensive.  They aren't hackable - they can't really grow and adapt.  They are for Dilbert not us.

We fell upon the ideas for these desks from many sources, have tweaked them for our own needs and would love to offer the benifit of our experience to others who find themselves in the same boat.

What We Need & What You Get

The Startup desk is manufactured from solid, honest raw materials:

  • 1 inch black iron pipe
  • 1 inch iron fittings
  • 2 layers of 3/4 inch plywood
  • The surface is stained and finished to a modern industrial type of finish

Order the plans, the parts or us to deliver it and assemble the parts for you.  For parts or delivered, order one 'perk' per desk needed.  Ideally, for deliveries it would be best to have 5 or more desks involved.  If you have special requests, variations to the design  we would be open to discuss.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you live outside of Ontario, the plans are your best bet.  With "the plans, we'll send you all the info you'll need to do this yourself.  Plus, we're here to provide technical and moral support.
