story:
Short Summary

Hello, My name is Janeen Edwards. I am a 15 year old high school honors student.

My mother is a single parent that breaks her back supporting my younger brother and I.  My mother, the amazing person that she is, raised me to believe that I could acomplish anything that put my mind to so long as I am determined and dedicated to my goals. 

I remember my mother reading to me every night before I went to bed and helping with my homework every single day when I got home from school. She instilled in me a passion for learning, and made sure that I would be able to have a better future than she had and that I was given opportunities that were not offered to her. Even though I come from a low income family she has never allowed it to put a strain on the things that I strive for in life.

Over the years, thanks to my mother, I felt the need to volunteer in my community and do well in my education. I joined my school key club and volunteer at my local VFW [A Veterans Center]. I participate in Drama Club, Newspaper, Debate Team, Book Club, Art Society and am also a member of my high school's Varsity Track and Cross Country teams.

I have always wanted to have an opportunity to study abroad in high school and establish myself as a global citizen. Earlier this year I applied to AFS Intercultural programs to study abroad in their Germany year program and was accepted. They have given me the opportunity to be an ambassador for AFS - established during World War 1 as the American Field Service.

After all the work that my mother has done for me over the years I want to know that I have made her proud just as much as I want to make my dreams happen. I have never worked so hard for something in my life and as much as mother wishes she could give me all the money that I need for this herself, we both know that she doesn't have that kind of money. All of my contributors would be helping me to achieve all that my mother has constantly pushed me to work hard for.

What We Need & What You Get

With the help of my mother I was able to receive financial aid and scholarships based on merit. Although my tuition has been paid in full my mother cannot afford to send me 240 miles to Washington D.C. to begin my program or send me the spending money that I will need to buy food, pay for transportation and communicate with my mother and family during the 10 months that I will be living with a host family in Germany. If I do not raise money I will not be able to participate in this program and all the hard work that my mother and I have put into this will have been for nothing. Out of the initial 17,500 I needed to raise I need the remaining $4,000.

  • $300 for the plane ticket 240 miles to Washington D.C. and fees
  • around $300 a month [$3000] for spending money; such as traveling back and forth on the train to school everyday, lunch money - German schools don't serve lunch so I have to find a place to eat in town, German pre-paid phone cards to call my mother and little brother, and the unknown expenses [emergencies, toiletries, shoes, gloves, a winter coat]
  • $200 for my residence permit to live in Germany for 10 months while I am studying abroad
  • $500 for a camera and other electronics - for my photo portfolio for college, a phone and laptop for the online classes I am taking to have sufficient credits to graduate from high school when I return home for my Senior year of high school.

With every contribution you will receive something in from me to show my gratitude, no matter how big or small the donate; I send a thank you to all of my contributors and depending on how much your contribute you can receive digital portraits drawn by me in a select choice of medium, graphic designs, personal blog templates and a digital album of my original photos taken in Germany.

The Impact

The AFS intercultural program works toward creating a more just and peaceful world by providing international and intercultural learning experiences to individuals, families, schools, and communities through a global volunteer partnership. By sponsoring me you will promoting all the things that this program stands for.

While I'm abroad with AFS, I'll be making friends with people in my host country and with other AFS Exchange Students from around the world. That is one of the ways I'll support the AFS Mission of creating a world of understanding and peace. When I return home, this program does not end for me: I will become a part of a worldwide network of AFS Returnees and and AFS ambassador. That group includes business leaders, politicians, diplomats, educators, entertainers, scientists, journalists, and even an astronaut. By contributing something, anything at all, you will not only be helping me accomplish this goal and become a part of this program but will also be helping me set a path for my future.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, and I understand completely. The economy has taken it's toll on many people, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Get the word out and tell you friends and family! You can Share my campaign and even follow me on my travel blog that I will be using to journal my experience for myself and all the friend that I won't be able to talk to while I'm abroad.

WWW.WITHLOVE-JANEEN.BLOGSPOT.COM

Thank you for reading this and considering helping me acheive something that I never knew I'd be able to have.

story:
Our site has launched! Check us out at knowyourix.org and help us ensure that students everywhere know their Title IX right to an education free from sexual violence and harassment. Many thanks to all our supporters for making this dream a reality!

In 1972, Title IX of the Education Amendments prohibited sex-based discrimination in schools, guaranteeing students essential and extensive rights to freedom from sexual violence necessary for equal access to education. In 2011, Vice President Biden clarified the standards to which higher education institutions must adhere, including specific guidelines for addressing reports of sexual misconduct.

Yet too many colleges today are failing to fulfill their legal and ethical obligations. In the past year, sexual violence survivors have shared their experiences of administrative neglect, disregard, and abuse at institutions including Amherst College, the University of North Carolina Chapel Hill, Yale University, Occidental College, Northwestern University, and Rice University. Their experiences are not unique but representative of sexually hostile campus environments across the country.

We believe it is time for change. Let’s make next semester better than this one.

 

Know Your IX is a campaign that aims to educate every college student in the U.S. about his or her rights under Title IX by the start of the Fall 2013 academic term. Armed with information, survivors will be able to advocate for themselves during their schools’ grievance proceedings and, if Title IX guarantees are not respected, to file a complaint against their colleges with the Department of Education’s Office for Civil Rights. When colleges are confronted with their students’ knowledge and thirst for justice, they will be forced to take proactive steps to end sexual violence, ensuring every student a safe educational environment.

 

 

 

Know Your IX is an activist collective run by students and young alumni who have successfully campaigned against their colleges' inadequate responses to campus sexual violence. We connected online through our activism, as featured in the New York Times. For media inquiries, please contact us at knowyourIX@gmail.com.

 

 

 

Know Your IX will educate students about their Title IX rights through a number of channels, primarily:

  • An extensive website with fact sheets and other resources (also available in campus women's centers across the U.S.) to inform students about their rights and the Title IX complaint process
  • An intensive social media campaign to make Title IX knowledge "go viral"
  • Full-page advertisements of Title IX rights in student newspapers the first week of the fall semester

Although we're committed to these projects, we're dedicated to responding to the needs of all survivors and student activists.

 

 

Why do we need your help? We need at least $10,000 to hire an experienced web developer, host a large site, pay our graphic designer and video editor for their completed and future work, and purchase ad space in student papers. And the more money we raise, the more we can do! Any contribution, however large or small, will strengthen our fight against campus sexual violence.

 

If you can't afford to give, you can still lend a hand in the fight against campus sexual violence. Share our Indiegogo page with friends, Tweet about us (@knowyourIX), and like us on Facebook!

 

 

 

Special thanks to Chika Ota (graphic design), Grace Needlman (video editing), our partner SAFER, and Magic Man for letting us use their song in our video.

story:
BISMILLAAHIR RAHMANIR RAHEEM

IN THE NAME OF GOD , MOST GRACIOUS MOST MERCIFUL.

Dear Sisters and Brothers, my name is Brother Abudu Ibn Adam and I am the father of our beloved Sister Aminatawallah (May Allah have mercy on her soul).

My daughter Aminatawallah (Rest In Peace) died at age 5 From direct course of 2009 Swine Flu H1N1 Swine Flu Vaccine injection.

May Allah give her His mercy. Ameen.

AMINATAWALLAH N.C. ABUDU, WAS  BORN A HEALTHY BABY ON JANUARY 19TH, 2004  IN TORONTO - ONTARIO AND DIED ON 5 DAYS LATER ON  NOVEMBER 28TH, 2009 AFTER BEEN SUMMONED BY THE FAMILY PHYSICIAN FOR THE 2009 SWINE FLU H1N1 VACCINE.

She was born a normal child with no deformity, never been rushed , admitted to any hospital since birth to death on any emegency or life threatening sickness,

A team player at day care to junior kindergarten.    She was cheerful girl full of vigor , energy , joy and happiness. She was a role model and inspirator  to her friends and classmates in Day care to Junior Kindergarten until

  EXCERPTS OF HER LASTS  WORDS TO HER CLASSMATES    “Friends, lets clean up, clean up , Canada loves us,let's join hands to keep our class clean “. Her usual speech at the end of each day  and final speech to be heard, on November 27th, 2009, at Boniface Catholic Day Care ,  until we join with her in Heaven. Ameen.

MAY SHE REST IN PERFECT PEACE AS WELL ALL THE MILLIONS OF VACCINES RELATED DEATHS AND ALL THE FAMILIES CARING FOR VACCINE RELATED INJURY PATIENTS .  AMEEN.

A LIFE CUT SHORT , FOR A CRIME SHE NEVER COMMITTED

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

She died from DIRECT cause of 2009 H1N1 swine flu vaccine & its injectables made with dangerous bio-ingredients, bio weaponry chemicals.

Mankind LET'S  say NO to non mandatory vaccines injection which affect our children dramatically.

Nowadays, more and more families are affected by such cases and with no support to deal with their adverse impacts.

Our prayers, also, go out to all families who have suffered such cruel, inhuman episode inflicted on us by our government in conjuction with World Health Organization, Health Canada, covered up by coroners and public health agencies.

DONATE GENEROUSLY TO THE TRUST ACCOUNT SET UP FOR LEGAL FEES TO ASSIST THE FAMILY WITH THIS HORRIBLE TRAGEDY !!!!!

We need your support for the legal case in court for justice for our beloved Sister and all families facing such cruel issues.

PLEASE DONATE GENEROUSLY TO THE LEGAL TRUST ACCOUNT SET UP BY ABUDU IBN ADAM & MRS MARIA HYACENTH ABUDU FOR JUSTICE.

SUPERIOR COURT OF ONTARIO FILE #  - CV- 114440375.

Toronto Dominion Bank , 2080 Danforth Avenue : Toronto, Ontario. M4C-1J9

ACCOUNT INFORMATION :  _SWIFT CODE_TDOMCATTTOR_

TRANSIT #_12682_004_08836348342 .

 

For inquiries and TAX RECEIPTS PLEASE:

Contact  : Abudu ibn Adam & Mrs Maria Hyacenth Abudu :416-429-8344  OR Email us adams1financial@yahoo.ca.

                                                            

The Impact:

Sisters and Brothers, let rally against and stand up for the impacts of these dangerous pharmaceutical companies using society as guinea pigs with bio weaponry dangerous chemicals.

Help us to win this legal case and obtain a jurisprudence case which will be a benefit for all of us in the future.

THIS CASE CAN HAPPEN TO ALL OF US, but we can react, be mindful and protect our children before it occurs.  May Allah helps us. Ameen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please pray  and make invocations for our little Sister Aminatawallah and all people, all families affected by these horrible events. We solemnly thank all those who donate and all who prayed for us as well.

Oh mankind & Wellwishers ,Please spread this important message .

God Bless us all, our families here and distant and forgive all those The Lord have taken unto himself.

May Allah protects us all, May Allah forgives us all & accept our good intention.

Ameen.

 Mrs Maria Hyacenth & M. Abudu ibn Adam, Aminatawallah's parents

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**ADVERSE REACTION REPORTS - Aminatawallah**

Aminatawallah's Abudu ,  her reported  reaction see below ( the last one on the list ) - Toronto Public Health reported this.  Shows "suspect" role in death. Why did they FAILED TO REPORT ,TO COVER UP THEIR CRIMINALITY, It’s a Crime they know they should have reported it within 7 days after Aminatawallah’s Death as a direct result of the GSK Vaccine.

story:
Short Summary

CHANGE - 2/7/13: NEW LESSER AMOUNT NEEDED!
INSTEAD of $1192.00 REALLY ONLY NEED TOTAL of $650.00

Woo Hoo! A great friend of mine covered RT airfare! Another very supportive SROH team member has covered the conference fees (ahead of late registration deadline saving another $45). Reducing the amount needed by over $500.

*Indiegogo will not allow you to change the amount once started so trying to announce it here. $650 Neede Less $285 Raised = $365.00 Left to Go!

Hello, my name is Christianna Capra "CC". I have been an EAGALA member since 2007 and am now a lifetime member.

Realizing that with my head buried in the running of 2 businesses and also freelancing to keep the bills paid, the 14th Annual EAGALA Conference is sneaking up on me...and...realizing that...I actually need to attend to keep my certification intact. Yikes!

The past 2 years have housed much growth, many enriching / expanding experiences, and also several challenges to overcome. One of the challenges has been cash flow, esp on the personal level since every dime I seem to make goes into, gets eaten by (literally) the businesses and my beloved 4 legged colleagues. I really need to get to Tennessee this March and have no real idea how to pay for it.

I get that I wont have the same draw that our rockstar mare Straw has, but still hopeful I can end up in Franklin TN on March 13th, 2013! :)

 

What We Need & What You Get

Essentially have done the math to the penny to get there. Am going to attempt an airline ticket via "miles" but here is the rest:

  • Conference Fee for 2013: $435.00 (plus balance due of last conference in 2011 of $185)= $620 Total.
  • Hotel contribution (sharing room with other members) of $200 for 3  nights.
  • Minimal expenses: airport parking, transportation from TN airport to hotel, transportation from conference back to airport, travel incidentals, etc. Total estimate is $175-200.
  • Airline ticket from Newark NJ to Nashville TN (leave on Wed 3/13 and return on Sat 3/16). I have some miles on AA so hoping to get my flight that way...
By going to this conference, I will keep my certification intact, I will make some imortant contacts and gain more knowledge to further forward both Spring Reins of Hope (LLC, 2008) and also Spring Reins of Life (501c3, 2011) to provide EAP and EAL services in NYC, NJ, and Eastern PA.
 
It has been a huge lesson for me to learn - to ask for help and support. This is a step in my growth to humble myself and raise a hand up for help (I dont have any issue asking on behalf of others /horses, but for me personally its easier to keep quiet and suffer around it. I am asking now. ;)
 

HISTORY & COMMITMENT TO "THE DREAM"...

In 2006, my totem horse had reached rock bottom in attempts to recover from Lyme Disease. This is the time when I met Dr. Judith Shoemaker, DVM who brought him back to health with alternative and holistic remedies. At the same time Dr. Shoemaker introduced me to the EAGALA Model of EAP and EAL where horses can help humans lead healthier more productive lives.

I became EAGALA Certified immediately, in that I knew it was my life's calling.
Except from the 2008 NWL book, Horses With A Mission: http://www.springreinsofhope.com/PDF/SROH-About%20Us%20-HorsesWithAMission-Final%20Web%202009%20Story.pdf

In 2008 I co-founded an LLC offering EAP and EAL services in NY, NJ and East PA called Spring Reins of Hope (www.springreinsofhope.com). SROH provides private pay sessions in EAP and EAL services for Individuals, Couples, Families, and Groups. Also for corporations and organizations.

In 2011 I co-founded a 501c3, called Spring Reins of Life (www.springreinsoflife.org) which is actively fund raising for its targeted populaitons - At Risk Youth, Military Veterans and their Families, and Bereaved Children. The nonprofit has a growing waiting list for services on Veterans and At Risk Youth with a much accellorated need for funding resources. However this is a good problem for a budding NP to have.

Hard to be public here, but with the bills on the table and the projected income for next few months, there will not be any extra money to go to this conference. I am putting it in the hands of the creator to help find a way.

Let Go, and Let God - my Mother would say! So here is my letting go, and letting God - Please help me out.

For more information on the EAGALA Conference for this coming year in Franklin TN, see:  http://www.eagala.org/14thConf

 

The Impact

Providing a security in mind to keep pushing the development of both businesses. If I am not current on certification this will cause a whole load of other problems to solve.

Shot in the arm! Being at the conference this year will provide some much needed connection, grounding, networking, and collaboration with other fellow EAGALA facilitators. I have been separated from the herd for 2 years. Other members have reached out to ask if I will be in TN, so I would love to, and I think I really need to say "Yes".

CC is playing the lottery once a week, (will only waste $1.00) for many reasons. However with less than 8 weeks left...it feels MORE realistic that this campaign will have better chances of being fulfilled.  LOL.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

As much as anyone, I do know exactly what its like to be expending effort  rubbing 2 nickels together to create 5 dollars! So if you cannot contribute, I understand. Maybe you can...

  • Say a prayer for our prayers to be heard/answered.
  • Have Airline Miles on hand?...I need a RT ticket! xo
  • Forward this link to anyone you think might be able to contribute.
  • Offer assistance in the way of volunteering (if in NJ - less farm work done by moi could be spent earning more money...)
  • Offer other ideas or options for travel, lodging in TN (near to Franklin)
  • Just simply tell me to "not give up!" :)

story:
Dear Indie Go-Go Donors,

 

Thank you so much for your support and donation to the Biscuit Brothers Fine Arts Farm. Although we did not reach our Indie go-go goal, due to a couple of wonderful corporate sponsors, we did have enough to submit a slightly different but legitimate proposal on the identified property. The contract was submitted this morning and we should have their response within 72 hours.

 

If the seller rejects our offer, all donations will be returned within the week. Never fear though, I am committed to make this happen if need be in another location somehow someway in 2013. And hey, it’s the holiday season, so regardless of the outcome, your fun Biscuit perks are in the mail!

 

So please keep your fingers crossed for the Biscuit Brothers Fine Arts Farm in 2013. And thanks again for your support.

 

Jerome

******************************************************************

Jerome Schoolar, Producer and Co-Creator of the Emmy Award winning PBS show “The Biscuit Brothers” is calling on fans to support the building of a new Fine Arts Farm in South Austin that will be designed to provide music and arts education to the entire community. The proposed facility will include concert and theatre space as well as multiple classrooms, a themed outdoor area, and plenty of Magical Musical Farm décor.

 

“I want to create a space where we can entertain and educate kids and families of all ages in all sorts of ways,” said Jerome Schoolar, who plays Dusty on the show and has served as a City of Austin Fine Arts Coordinator for Children.  “Our vision includes regular classes, special concerts, theatrical guests, and more, with much of it low-cost or even free to Title 1 AISD schools and other at-risk members of our community.”

 

The Biscuit Brothers have a long history of providing inexpensive or free shows to the public - often benefitting other local organizations - and hope the new building near Slaughter Lane and I-35 will help sustain those as well as the TV show which is given to PBS for free.

 

“This is a big undertaking,” Schoolar said.  “We're going to need a lot of individuals and community partners to donate through the project at indiegogo.com we'll be launching on October 16, or even provide long-term sponsorship funds.”

 

$50,000 is needed to secure the property and begin upgrades.  Schoolar says he hopes to raise at least $25,000 with the indiegogo and another $25,000 from corporate sponsors.

 

“We've got some amazing rewards for our indiegogo supporters, including free classes and invitations to participate in the permanent decorations of the building.  For our top indiegogo donors or corporate sponsors, we're offering chances to name classrooms and more. And for everyone, we're offering the chance to help build a facility that has the potential to make a lasting impact across our entire community.”

 

Schoolar points to multiple studies on both the national and local scale that highlight the importance of Fine Arts training in education. “There's ample evidence showing that children who are actively involved in Fine Arts Education are smarter, healthier, and happier, and that exposure needs to begin as early as possible with reliable consistency. The Biscuit Brothers have always been about fostering musical education for young kids, and now we want to broaden that to a fully artistic and really fun Fine Arts Farm.”

 

If the funding goal to open the Biscuit Brothers Fine Arts Farm is not reached then all donations will be returned.

 

 

About the Biscuit Brothers Television Project

               

The Biscuit Brothers began broadcasting in 2005 and is made available for free to PBS stations throughout the United States. The show can currently be seen in 30+ markets.

 

The Biscuit Brothers perform live concerts across the U.S., create educational materials for teachers and parents, and use their profile to help non-profit organizations raise money and awareness for programs including hospitals, schools, and other family-focused causes they believe are important.

 

The Biscuit Brothers Children’s Television Project relies on private and corporate donations and the sale of their own CDs and DVDs to fund their production.

story:
My name is Elena Gramatikovska. I am 26. I live and work in Skopje, Macedonia.

I am a concert pianist/piano teacher/CEO of an NGO that delivers leadership training.

This January I discovered my dream MA:"Artist Programme in Leadership" at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama in London. After a successful audition I was accepted and offered a place on the September 2012 programme. 

As a non EU citizen I don't have access to the scholarship funds I need to make this a reality. 

In order to keep my place at the school and start the Visa procedure I need to raise 8,000GBP by June 10th. 

My vision is to bring leadership and music together in service of education.

My mission is to transform education into an inspiring, motivating process that will fully develop the potential of every person and encourage their authenticity. 

I need to raise 8,000GBP which is the remainder of the tuition fee for the "Artist Programme in Leadership" at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama.

I believe that music needs to be used more in educational purposes. I also believe that its potential to educate and transform is currently not fully used.

With 20 years of piano playing experience combined with 4 years of establishing and running a successful leadership NGO I believe I can bring music and leadership together. I have made an impact in both areas separately. It's my dream to integrate them through my work as an educator. I know that this MA programme will give me the skills I need to achieve this in practice.   

By investing in this campaign you are investing in the potential of a better future education. 

If you can't donate to my campaign I would really appreciate if you could spread the word about it If you share my vision you can track my progress at www.the8krun.com and I would love to hear from you.

story:
All life on this planet shares DNA.


DNA on a SHIRT™ displays what makes us different, and, more important, the bonds we share with all life. Primates have the closest DNA percentage to humans, with the orangutan alone sharing 96.4% DNA similarity.


At the time when this project was undertaken, the Phoenix Zoo was the proud home of the oldest living Bornean orangutan in North America: Duchess, a 52 year-old female. As one of the first animals to arrive at the Zoo, Duchess charmed the hearts of many the minute she arrived. She was born in the jungles of Borneo, where she was orphaned at a very young age. When Duchess came to Phoenix in 1962, it was determined that she was approximately two years old.

 

During her life, Duchess, the eventual matriarch of the Phoenix Zoo’s orangutan family, gave birth to seven babies. Currently, her three remaining children, along with her grandchildren, are living in zoos across the country. Her legacy lives on through her offspring, and she and her family have been strong ambassadors for their species.

Early in June 2012, keepers started to notice that Duchess wasn’t feeling well.  The Phoenix Zoo’s on-site veterinary staff determined that she was suffering from high grade lymphosarcoma. This extreme form of cancer spread aggressively over the course of a couple weeks, and she passed away on June 24, 2012. Though she is gone, she lives on in the hearts of many.

Duchess entertained and mesmerized millions of visitors over her five decades at the Zoo. Most often, guests and staff would comment on her eyes and that when she looked at you, she seemed to be staring straight into your soul. She was wise and majestic, funny and serious, and playful and beautiful.

Denise Wagner joined the Phoenix Zoo as part of the primate staff in 2004 and was one of two main caregivers of Duchess and the other primates. Duchess had a tremendous impact on her and the other staff members. “She really made me realize what it was like to be an ambassador for the species," Wagner says.

 “Duchess lives on at the Phoenix Zoo in Bess, Kasih and her other offspring in zoos across the country. She is not gone, as her legacy is still carried on with her family,” expressed Wagner. “She will always be remembered and havea special place in our hearts.”

DNA on a SHIRT wants to honor Duchess' importance and impact by highlighting her as the first animal to be presented on the premiere DNA ZOO TEE™. We want the shirts to be a celebration of her life, in memory of her and the legacy that she has left on the world. The Phoenix Zoo will receive 20% of all sales to go toward conservation efforts.

 

 

We want to use the premiere Duchess DNA print in the same way that Wagner envisions them;


“As her last great act as an ambassador for her species.”


The shirts and prints are designed to promote awareness and, more important, our connection. DNA ZOO TEES promises to help engage and show our connection, through the DNA fingerprint, narration panel and comparative badge on each shirt. We strongly believe that our products will engage people and help raise awareness. We feel that someday soon, zoos may be the only place where endangered animals will be able to exist.

 

The shirts are made of 100% brushed cotton, with the graphic color burned into the shirt to ensure comfort and durability. DNA ZOO TEES stand out from many other products on the market today.


Our vision for DNA on a SHIRT is that with our products, we create a catalyst for engagement through our vision of inspiring art, science and people. 

Welcome to our introductory early adopter retail program. By purchasing one of our three pre-sale release products listed below, you are receiving the products as perks; a special privilege or side benefit of taking part in our unique, new campaign.

Perks:

$5 perk (shipping not included): You will receive a special edition postcard featuring the DNA fingerprint and composite image of Duchess the orangutan. The prints are in memory of Duchess, the oldest Bornean orangutan before her passing. The prints are all limited edition with no reprints, in a unique color and design. Note: This perk only includes the postcard.

$25 perk (shipping not included): You will receive a special edition DNA ZOO TEE t-shirt featuring the DNA fingerprint and composite image of Duchess the orangutan. The prints are in memory of Duchess, the oldest Bornean orangutan before her passing. The prints are all limited edition, with no reprints in a unique color and design. Note: This perk only includes the DNA ZOO TEE.

$75 perk (shipping not included): You will receive a special edition 16x20 Wallable™ rolled canvas print ready for mounting, featuring the DNA fingerprint and composite image of Duchess the orangutan. The prints are in memory of Duchess, the oldest Bornean orangutan before her passing. The prints are all limited edition, with no reprints in a unique color and design, and come with a certificate of authenticity. Note: This perk only includes the Wallable art piece.

We understand that it is easy to write one check or make one donation; that is not what we are asking for in this campaign. By purchasing our products, we want you to help us effortlessly engage a majority of people to see and like our product, and each, by altruistic default, give something back with every purchase, and, at the same time, help raise awareness.

Support the Phoenix Zoo by purchasing a DNA print, note card or t-shirt. 

We are going to make a difference and you can help!

Purchase now!

 

NOTE:

 The video says that humans share 98.6% DNA similarity to orangutans; the percentage is actually 96.4%, as stated in the campaign copy. We apologize for any confusion this may have caused.

 

How this will work:

When you place your order for a shirt through the Indiegogo site:

1) It will tally in the campaign and register that you want a shirt or print.

2) We will compile the list and contact you to find out the size, color and style of the shirt you want via email.

3) Your card will be charged at the END of the campaign; we then create and ship your shirt. We have been notified that some cards are being charged at the time of purchase and NOT at the end of the campaign. We are currently looking into this and we get back with an answer shortly.

4) A shipping charge will be added to your payment at the end of the campaign. Shipping cost will vary, depending on location.

5) Some of you who have purchased perks in the past may have noticed that your name has disappeared or that the perk has changed. Don't fret! We still have your purchase on file and will be emailing you to find out the specifications of your order. We appreciate your leniency with this issue.

This will help immensely with giving us a precise number of shirts and sizes needed, and is a great method to keep production cost down and allow us to only produce exactly what is needed.

Keep in mind, these are going to be limited edition productions that won't be repeated after we scale up production for our pending retail contract. (I can't wait to disclose who our new vendor is...)

 

Cheers,

Darrin

Duchess had a tremendous impact on her and the other staff members. “She really made me realize what it was like to be an ambassador for the species," Wagner says.

DNA on a SHIRT wants to honor Duchess' importance and impact by highlighting her as the first animal to be presented on the premiere DNA ZOO TEE™. We want the shirts to be a celebration of her life, in memory of her and the legacy that she has left on the world. The Phoenix Zoo will receive 20% of all sales to go toward conservation efforts.
 

 
We want to use the premiere Duchess DNA print in the same way that Wagner envisions them;
“As her last great act as an ambassador for her species.”
The shirts and prints are designed to promote awareness and, more important, our connection. DNA ZOO TEES promises to help engage and show our connection, through the DNA fingerprint, narration panel and comparative badge on each shirt. We strongly believe that our products will engage people and help raise awareness. We feel that someday soon, zoos may be the only place where endangered animals will be able to exist.

 
The shirts are made of 100% brushed cotton, with the graphic color burned into the shirt to ensure comfort and durability. DNA ZOO TEES stand out from many other products on the market today.
 Our vision for DNA on a SHIRT is that with our products, we create a catalyst for engagement through our vision of inspiring art, science and people. 
Welcome to our introductory early adopter retail program. By purchasing one of our three pre-sale release products listed below, you are receiving the products as perks; a special privilege or side benefit of taking part in our unique, new campaign.
Perks:
$5 perk (shipping not included): You will receive a special edition postcard featuring the DNA fingerprint and composite image of Duchess the orangutan. The prints are in memory of Duchess, the oldest Bornean orangutan before her passing. The prints are all limited edition with no reprints, in a unique color and design. Note: This perk only includes the postcard.

$25 perk (shipping not included): You will receive a special edition DNA ZOO TEE t-shirt featuring the DNA fingerprint and composite image of Duchess the orangutan. The prints are in memory of Duchess, the oldest Bornean orangutan before her passing. The prints are all limited edition, with no reprints in a unique color and design. Note: This perk only includes the DNA ZOO TEE.

$75 perk (shipping not included): You will receive a special edition 16x20 Wallable™ rolled canvas print ready for mounting, featuring the DNA fingerprint and composite image of Duchess the orangutan. The prints are in memory of Duchess, the oldest Bornean orangutan before her passing. The prints are all limited edition, with no reprints in a unique color and design, and come with a certificate of authenticity. Note: This perk only includes the Wallable art piece.

We understand that it is easy to write one check or make one donation; that is not what we are asking for in this campaign. By purchasing our products, we want you to help us effortlessly engage a majority of people to see and like our product, and each, by altruistic default, give something back with every purchase, and, at the same time, help raise awareness.
Support the Phoenix Zoo by purchasing a DNA print, note card or t-shirt. 
We are going to make a difference and you can help!
Purchase now!
 
NOTE:
 The video says that humans share 98.6% DNA similarity to orangutans; the percentage is actually 96.4%, as stated in the campaign copy. We apologize for any confusion this may have caused.
 
How this will work:
When you place your order for a shirt through the Indiegogo site:
1) It will tally in the campaign and register that you want a shirt or print.
2) We will compile the list and contact you to find out the size, color and style of the shirt you want via email.
3) Your card will be charged at the END of the campaign; we then create and ship your shirt. We have been notified that some cards are being charged at the time of purchase and NOT at the end of the campaign. We are currently looking into this and we get back with an answer shortly.
4) A shipping charge will be added to your payment at the end of the campaign. Shipping cost will vary, depending on location.
5) Some of you who have purchased perks in the past may have noticed that your name has disappeared or that the perk has changed. Don't fret! We still have your purchase on file and will be emailing you to find out the specifications of your order. We appreciate your leniency with this issue.
This will help immensely with giving us a precise number of shirts and sizes needed, and is a great method to keep production cost down and allow us to only produce exactly what is needed.
Keep in mind, these are going to be limited edition productions that won't be repeated after we scale up production for our pending retail contract. (I can't wait to disclose who our new vendor is...)
 
Cheers,
Darrin

story:
Jump Start automilez

automilez is a GPS-based mileage logging application designed to capture your tax-saving mileage deductions. We want to make automilez even better, but as a small software development company, we could use some help paying for it. 

Our in-house development team is a group of hard-working, skilled artisans that put in long hours to perfect automilez. We need your help to improve the already valuable, money-saving tool, all while keeping the app and Logbook cost-efficient. Your donations will allow us to keep improving automilez and make the best-of-its-kind tool even better.

Added Features

We want to make automilez a more robust product and our users have been asking for features they'd like to see. The 5 features below are the most requested and we estimate it will cost $15,000 to add these features to automilez.

  • Pause a trip
  • Add in trip tags (when trip is running)
  • Notification when trip is running (saving your battery if you forget a trip is running)
  • Adding multiple cars for each trip
  • Improved Excel reports

Perks

In return, we're offering a set of perks to our jump starters. All of our perks involve free access to the automilez online Logbook. The Logbook allows you to edit and manage all of your trips and download Excel reports of your trips.

  • $30 donations receive free automilez online Logbook for a year.
  • $500 donations receive free automilez online Logbook for life.
  • $1000 donations receive free automilez online Logbook for life, a shout out on the app's about page as one of our top jump starters, and the opportunity to vote on the order we develop the features in.
  • A $5000 donation receives free automilez online Logbook for life, a shout out on the app's about page as one of our top jump starters, and the choice of what feature we develop first.

If we don't reach our goal, we'll put what we raise towards these features and keep working towards expanding our feature set and improving automilez.

The automilez Impact

We believe in the product we're building and the dedicated people building it. Our product saves our customers money and time and we'd like the opportunity to make it even better.

story:
Hola! Bienvenidos! Welcome!

Thank you for watching our video for Surf Strong.  We are Sarah and Jerson, and we have started Surf Strong to help a small community in El Salvador, where young kids often have very little parental involvement and limited opportunity.  These kids spend a lot of time in the streets with negative influences and not enough to do, where they develop toxic friendships.  They ultimately become consumed within the circle of extreme poverty so widespread within El Salvador.  To escape this circle, parents and families often encourage their young children to make the dangerous migration to the United States to earn money and provide for the family illegally.  To these families, it is a choice between life and death; there is no other choice for their youth.

Surf Strong is designed to provide an alternative.  We will provide a safe, positive environment in these kids' lives through a connection to surfing.  Through Surf Strong, the children will have access to surf boards and lessons, as well as lessons in English, photography, business, and more.  With their growing connection to the beach, they will develop a sense of pride in the beautiful place they come from, and they will learn to take responsibility for their home, their actions, and their futures as they develop confidence and skills that will translate to all aspects of life. 

Surf Strong is working to develop the next generation, of strong, confident, and capable leaders, and we need your help.  We are designed to be sustainable, however we need to raise our start-up funds.  Once we are off the  ground, we will be able to maintain our programs, only fundraising for expansion endeavors.  For every $200 raised, we can reach about 10 more kids per week...this week, next week, and every week after that.  Over the course of five years, that same $200 will still be helping kids!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need surfboards!  Ten softtop longboards to be exact, although the more we have, the more kids we can help.  Additionally, as the kids get better, they will move to standard shortboards, which we can buy used off of tourists looking to sell their boards quickly.  The longboards cost about $200 each, so we are looking at $2000 upfront in boards and another $1000 as the kids become more advanced.
  • We also need rashguards!  Rashguards are important, as a surf school without rashguards is like a hockey team without jerseys!  We want the kids to feel like they are a part of something awesome.  For some, this will be the first time in their lives they have something to be proud of.  Rashguards are expensive though, and we are looking at about $800-$1000 for this cost.
  • Other crucial components include chairs and a canopy tent on the beach, so participants have somewhere safe and fun to hang out while they escape the sun between sessions.  We also need signs to make our organization legitimate.  It isn't much, but culturally, if you have spent even a small amount of money on a sign, you mean serious business.  Total cost, approximately $400.
  • We are planting a small garden to grow vegetables for lunches!  We will provide a healthy meal to every kid, every day.  Many of these kids beg for food during the day so they can eat at night, and eat little more than beans and tortillas every single day.  The cost of the garden is approximately $150.


Check out the perks to the side to get more information on what we can now afford due to your generous donation!

    The Impact

    In the United States recently, you may have seen news about growing numbers of unaccompanied minors.  These young kids are mostly from the countries of El Salvador, Nicaragua, Honduras, and Guatemala.  The reason is this: THEY HAVE NO CHOICE.

    Often times, these kids are targeted by violence, or have become the breadwinners for their mothers, sisters, and younger brothers, and if they stay in their country they can maybe hope to make $5 a day with back breaking labor.  

    We want to change this.  We want these kids growing up in their communities knowing that there are viable opportunities out there for them to succeed.  With Surf Strong, kids will be exposed to our ten fundamental themes with a surfboard tucked under their arm.   Our ten themes; Determination, Courage, Patience, Responsibility, Respect, Self-Control, Integrity, Understanding, Kindness, and Humility; are key for every child's success.

    Risks & Challenges

    Our biggest risk & challenge is if we cannot build our income generating activities (surf lessons for tourists, volunteers, room rentals) before the money runs out.  If this is the case, I will be heading back to the US (and Jerson too if he can get a visa!) to run more fundraisers and save more of my own money to put towards our dream.  Our ideal funding situation is to raise our start-up costs, with an additional $5000 to gain momentum while we build our financial sustainability.   

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you checked your couch cushions and there is no spare change, there are other ways to help.  We are hosting a variety of fundraisers, and we would appreciate every like and share you can throw our way!  Additionally, perhaps your network or connections could help us to lower our costs.  Who do you know who can help?  Find us on facebook at www.facebook.com/surfstrongyouth!

story:
What is Bully Proof ? It's a proven system which shows students EXACTLY what to do & how to respond, step-by-step, in detail when being bullied, (before, during and after an encounter), and EXACTLY how to stand-up, step-by-step, to help others being bullied.

Is it effective? The Bully Proof system was developed by Tim (The Bully Doctor) Hutchinson, and he has taught this system at hundreds of schools to thousands of students resulting in bullying being reduced an average of 80%. This system has been thoroughly researched, time-tested, and proven over and over again for more than a decade. Plus it is credited with stopping four school shootings and preventing over fifty teen suicides.

                                        

What's unique about Bully Proof? Many organizations and websites are in the “awareness” phase of bullying – and while it’s helpful to continue to spread the message that bullying hurts, that alone simply does not stop the bullying. Very few are in the “correction” phase (that’s where we fix it!) and their programs cost all the way up into the thousands of dollars, PLUS most simply do not have the track record that Bully Proof does. Our system has been proven over-and-over again for more than a decade, and is the only complete system which will be available to students at no-charge.

Who is The Bully Doctor? Since 1999 The Bully Doctor has worked to stop bullying with students, parents, education officials, juvenile detention centers, civic groups, and other outreach efforts. He is the author of several books, has been a consultant on teen issues with the United States Department of Justice, MTV, and seen on NBC, ABC, CBS, and Fox News. After traveling to hundreds of schools and seeing firsthand the devastating effects bullying has on students, The Bully Doctor is committed to making sure the Bully Proof system is available for free to all students nationwide.

                                                   

                                

A few examples of the effectiveness of the system:


Student 1, approached me after learning the Bully Proof system and said she no longer wanted “to do it.” When asked what she was referring to, she admitted to having a “hit list” and a “gun” in her locker – she said I was her hero and asked if I’d go with her while she turned herself in.

Student 2, was at school one morning clearing out his locker so his dad wouldn’t have to after he committed suicide - something he planned to do that very afternoon. As he walked by the gymnasium he heard me teaching the Bully Proof system to a large group of students (600+). Intrigued by what I was saying he came in and sat down. Afterwards he approached a teacher and told of his plans, and said my message had given him hope that he wouldn't be bullied any more. After counseling and some family therapy he went on to college.

Student 3, came to me during a Bully Proof presentation and said she was being bullied. She also said the reason why was because about a year ago her father had committed suicide. One of the things I told her was that she needed new friends, ones that would stand up for her. It became my mission that day to find her three (3) new, good friends. By the end of the day I had found her fifty-two (52), and they had formed a club to help each other through difficult times using the Bully Proof system. Last I heard they had over 200 members and began including junior classes; that way the club would continue after the original students graduated.

     


Clearly now is the time to place this into the hands of every student in America. With this information students CAN stop being bullied, HELP others being bullied, and bring about REAL change to their schools and communities.

Is it really free? With the amount of research, development, and testing that has gone into this system it's easily worth hundreds of dollars. However, did you know that one in seven kids in America live in poverty? ONE in SEVEN! That's literally hundreds of thousands, or even millions of students that wouldn't be able to afford the Bully Proof system. That's why we're crowd funding, so we can give this system away to every student at no charge. 

Sounds good, now what? Right now, we have the opportunity to make a huge difference in the lives of so many kids - but we can't do it alone. If you've ever wanted a "Dare To Be Great" moment, this is it. Join us as we make tomorrow a better place for all students! 

                      

Funds raised through this campaign will directly towards;

A. Advertise the availability of this system to students, parents and schools; create a national awareness of the campaign, promote extensive social media outreach, facilitate mailings to schools and teen outreach organizations, and creating more channels through which students may access the Bully Proof system. 
*hiring publicists for full-scale national PR campaign
*extensive social media outreach, including ads on Facebook, and other social media.
*mailings to schools and teen outreach organizations
*paid advertisements on websites that teens frequently visit

B. Bandwidth required to allow students access to the Bully Proof system

C. Fulfilling perks from this campaign (t-shirts, books, program covers, etc.)

D. Taxes 

          


What will happen if we raise more money than we're asking for?

All extra funds will be used for the following:

A. Produce a Bully Proof training video and make it available on YouTube for free.

B. Train additional staff for AskTheBullyDoctor.com - our main website where students can ask questions about bullying and get answers for free. We expect the traffic to increase greatly after the release of Bully Proof, and we'll need more people to handle the requests for help in a timely manner.

C. Provide tour support for Reverse Order; a band travelling to schools nationally and talking about bullying and telling them about the free Bully Proof system.

D. Outreach programs to schools: Offer assistance to schools that lack adequate funding to address the bullying issue. Resources include: Live presentations by The Bully Doctor, one-on-one counseling, training sessions for staff, printed copies of Bully Proof, implementation, and after-care programs.

          

How will we keep in touch with the contributors after Bully Proof is released?

A special page will be created on our website at AskTheBullyDoctor.com where we'll post progress updates, news and developments including pictures and videos. A link to that page will be provided to all contributors.

All members of our team are volunteers, and no salaries are paid to anyone. All contributions go directly towards stopping bullying.

story:
Who? - I'm a fire-starter, a transformational coach, a style junkie, and a miracle worker - I connect with people, I have powerful conversations with them, and their lives are miraculously transformed. 


I'm a son, a brother, an uncle, and a man with a dream - like  many of you. 

I was the kid who setup lemonade stands, had mini yard-sales, and held car washes in wigs and dresses to create money, because I knew my parents didn't always have it to give, and because it was fun. I'm grateful for those experiences. 

As an adult, I've inspired many, I've served many, and I continue to base my life around creation, contribution, and service (e.g. I once called a handful of local radio stations and asked everyone listening to bring winter clothing to my place of employment so I could donate clothes to the homeless, and that's just one story). 

I've helped people launch careers and businesses and communities that would go on to serve many more, creating a ripple effect and contributing to the evolution of our wonderful world. 

Why? - Have you ever dreamed of something more, but found yourself too afraid (judgement, failure, success) to take a leap into uncertainty and risk it all.

"But what if I fail?" But what if you don't...


You know when you see someone do something bold and crazy, and you light up inside. You're inspired in that moment, and you think to yourself "Man, I wish I had the guts to do ______ (e.g. chase your dreams, dance like nobody's watching, leap before you're ready)!" I wished I did to, and then I did it. That's what this is about. 
I'm doing it, but I need your help beloved. I'm asking for your help in creating an experience that I believe with all of my heart will create a ripple effect, as all actions do. In contributing to me, you are also contributing to you, and to the many others I will go onto serve through my work. 

This isn't about vacation - so far, nothing about this experience has been relaxing. In fact, if one were looking for a "vacation" I'd probably look elsewhere - I've never felt more uncomfortable, and it's never felt more worth it.

This is about transformation, and the transformation has already begun, and in the last month alone, I've served a number of people through my work - people with a mission like my own. A mission to serve the masses.  And I'm just getting started.

What I Need & What You Get


I need to create/raise $6,000 (CAD) in order to attend this retreat on April 24th, 2015. The money you contribute to my campaign will go towards helping me create the following: 

  • The retreat experience, which includes life-coaching, group experiences, business/career coaching to make career changes/build a new business/increase the purpose of my business, excursions, food, meditation, yoga, and reflective exercises and materials. 
  • The upgrading of my skills, wisdom, and experience as a coach and as a being, which will allow me to serve YOU and others more powerfully.
  • A dream come true - because let's face it, I'm not dying or getting married (yet), or going to build schools in less fortunate countries, or feeding the homeless (though I have and I will continue to do so), but all these things can and will happen, and this is a valuable piece of the puzzle.


PERKS!!!

The perks I'm offering include virtual coaching sessions, where you will get to experience the power of my work first-hand, and if you've watched the video and read the perks, you know what kinda of transformation is possible in a single conversation. Also, I'm offering  a special shout-out in my victory video to those of you who contribute, AND I've added a bit of a wacky, wild, and hilarious bonus... YOU READY!?

If I raise $6000 before or by the final date, I will show-up to the MTS Centre in downtown Winnipeg, on Saturday, April 11th at 1:00PM, tunes in tow, and I will bare it all for Bali! Picture me in my Winnipeg Jets underwear, the middle of downtown Winnipeg, dropping it like it's hot to Pharell's "Happy", Timbaland's "Pass At Me" or Kim Cesarion's "Undressed"....

LOL! Uh. Wait. That came out wrong... Anywho! This just goes to show how crazy-committed I am to conquering this courageous challenge.
Oh, AND I'll get the dance on video and upload it, for those of you who can't make it out that day. 

AND! Even if I don't quite reach my entire goal, the funds will still go towards the Bali Retreat. I expect challenges to arise, and I've prepared for them by reaching out to other contributors, creating a local fundraising event, and coaching/serving my butt off.

The Impact

Picture this: I sit down with a young man or woman whose goal is to create a community or a business or a life that will allow them to help and serve others, and to positively impact the world, but their fears and limiting beliefs are preventing them from taking action. They seek my help, and through the work that I do, they're able to bust through all of that and take action, which results in a a business or a community that now serves dozens, and hundreds, and thousands of other people.
I believe I'm good at what I do - it's more who I AM than what I do -  and I could be GREAT. I WILL be GREAT. 
My growth and transformation began the moment I committed to this experience, and it will continue. Your contribution of $25, $60, $100, or more, goes towards helping me create this Bali Retreat, which results in more powerful coaching and service, and more of the change you seek - more of the change WE seek - within ourselves and within the world.

Your generosity and contribution is appreciated and will not be forgotten or squandered. I will continue to pay-it-forward, contribute frequently, and serve always - as I have in previous times. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If what I've shared resonates with you in any way, would you please do me the honour of sharing my campaign via word-of-mouth, social media, email, etc. You simply click on the appropriate Indiegogo share tool/button, and ask your community to check it out and contribute if they feel called to do so. 

LOVE  YOU GUYS!!! Thank you SO SO MUCH for your time, your love, and your contribution! 

May we all continue to LEAP, LEAD, DREAM, and DARE GREATLY. <3

story:
Hi:

    My name is Ernie and I am a regular and normal guy living in a small town: Calexico, California. I was alarmed when read a report of how many kids are reported missing every year: 800,000 ! Like 2,000 kids a day!!! I served 2 years as treasurer in the local chapter for a national nonprofit organization (Elks) , and actual secretary on a local nonprofit (Calexico Baja Runners).

    Our campaign is based on the right that every kid deserves to be happy and free. We want to provide with one GPS tracking wrist watch to 10,000 kids in America. Our goal is to raise funds and donate the GPS watch to local, state and nationwide organizations such as: The National Center for Missing and Exploited Children, Child Help, Shared Hope International and National Autism Association, to mention a few. We planned to donate to your local missing kids and autism chapters, also. We will be open for your suggestions on that.

                                                                   

       

    • The Magnitude of Missing Children's:

    Missing children

    The most recent, comprehensive national study for the number of missing children estimated in 1999: 

    ·  Approximately 800,000 children younger than 18 were reported missing. This is an alarming 2,000 children’s per day.

    ·  More than 200,000 children were abducted by family members.

    ·  More than 58,000 children were abducted by nonfamily members.

    ·  An estimated 115 children were the victims of “stereotypical” kidnapping. These “stereotypical” kidnappings involved someone the child did not know or was an acquaintance. The child was held overnight, transported 50 miles or more, killed, ransomed or held with the intent to keep the child permanently.

    Missing Children with Autism

    Nearly half of children with autism will wander, or elope, from safe environments. And more than one-third of children who wander are considered nonverbal. Finding and safely recovering a missing child with autism presents unique and difficult challenges for families, law enforcement, first responders and search teams. The National Center for Missing & Exploited Children has special search protocols and checklists to help first responders.

    Children with autism go missing under a variety of circumstances. They may seek out small or enclosed spaces. They may wander toward places of special interest to them. Or they may try to escape overwhelming stimuli such as sights, sounds, surroundings or activities of others.

    Attraction to water

    Children with autism often have an extremely high attraction to water. Because of this we strongly recommend first responders and search teams immediately check all nearby bodies of water in an effort to head-off the child. These bodies of water include but are not limited to streams, ponds, lakes, rivers, creeks, storm-water retention/detention basins and swimming pools.

    Other dangerous attractions

    Children with autism may exhibit other interests that pose similar dangers such as:

    ·  Roadways/highways.

    ·  Trains.

    ·  Heavy equipment.

    ·  Fire trucks.

    ·  Roadway signs.

    ·  Bright lights.

    ·  Traffic signals.

                  

    What We Need & What You Get

    • With every $99 donation, you will receive a GPS tracking wrist watch with a retail price of $149. For every 2.5 of your kind donation of $99, it will help us donate (1) One GPS watch for one kid, free of charge!  Our Cost is $70, including shipping and handling and this campaign costs.
    • Your generous contribution will help at least 4,000 kids to have this device and improve or eliminate the chances of being abducted or missing.

    In order to reach our goal to donate completely free 4,000 gps watches, we need to raise $990,000 (10,000 watches).

    Our Perks!

      

    You will receive a brand new GPS Tracker Wrist Watch.The watch comes with a sms chip, you will need to activate this chip with your local cellular phone provider. We don't include this service with your contribution.

    • If we don't reach our entire goal:

    If case that we don’t achieve our goal of 10,000 watches, we will send the watches to all who make a donation, and the remaining balance will be utilized to paid all expenses, and to purchase as many watches that will be donated completely free to those kids! We want to provide as many watches free of charge as funds let us. Updates will be posted in the campaign site as we have them.


    The Impact

    • Just imagine what your generous contribution could make: 4,000 kids enjoying their freedom and happiness they deserve!

    Other Ways You Can Help:

    If you need more than 100 watches, we can made arrangements to get them. Just send us a message and will give you the best price.

    We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, share our link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/stop-child-missing/

story:
My name is John Haywood and with Jim Jump, the Secretary of the International Brigade Memorial Trust and other Oxfordshire members Colin Carritt, Chris Farman and Liz Woolley, we are raising funds to pay for a memorial to the 28 men and women from Oxfordshire who fought to defend the Spanish Republic against Franco's rebels who were supported by fascist Germany and Italy.

There are over 100 similar memorials throughout the British Isles  and a memorial in Oxford is long overdue in order to recognise the sacrifice these brave people made, seven of whom were killed in action.

By supporting this appeal you will help to ensure  future generations and visitors to Oxford will be made aware of the cause for which they fought, some of whom may be encouraged to discover more about the Spanish Civil War and the work of the International Brigade Memorial Trust.


We have already raised  nearly £3,000 from local organisations but need another £3,000 to pay for the memorial and its erection in the centre of Oxford. In addition we are producing a booklet which includes brief biographies of the volunteers and holding a discussion evening with a  panel of experts on the Spanish War and on some of the members of the British Battalion of the International Brigade from Oxfordshire.
We are also organising a concert for Saturday 6th September which we hope will raise more money for the appeal. Following a buffet supper performers will be: The Sea Green Singers; The cast of the No Pasaran musical; Ran Kan kan and John Christie a solo barritone. Felicity White will read La Passionaria's Farewell Speech to the International Brigades with an English translation by Marlene Sideway, The IBMT President.

Every contribution made to our appeal will help but for sums over £10 a range of unique Perks are available to encourage you to be generous! See below for further details.

If we exceed our target any surplus will go to the IBMT Education Fund.
If we don't achieve our target we shall hold more concerts and make further appeals until we do! The Memorial will happen probably now on 25th October as it cannot now be unveiled on 6th September!





Other Ways You Can Help

We realise not everyone can afford to donate but you can still contribute to our appeal by spreading the word, Use the Indiegogo share tools for Facebook and Twitter

story:
Hello Friends and Family!

As you most likely know, both Katie and I (Torrie) are studying Intercultural Studies with a TESOL (teaching English as a second language) emphasis here at Lee University. We both share a desire to see God glorified through people of all nations turning to him. With an understanding of the weight of the Great Commission and a statistical knowledge of those who have yet to hear the name of Jesus, we are academically equipping ourselves for a life of ministry we have been called to. The benefits of in-class learning are huge, but it is now time integrate what we have learned (thus far) into a “hands-on” experience on the mission field.

This year, we have been blessed with the opportunity to be a part of Cru (Campus Crusades for Christ), which is a campus-wide discipleship ministry. Through this organization we have been invited to join a group of about twelve other students to embark on a journey to Central Asia. As a whole, this region is heavily influenced by the Islamic religion and is in desperate need of the Gospel. We will be building relationships, primarily on a college campus, through English language cafes. We are praying these relationships lead to (or are formed around) Gospel conversations causing our friends to put their faith in the saving work of Jesus Christ. Not only do we desire for these specific individuals to direct their worship towards God, the Father of Jesus Christ, but for this to extend to the rest of the surrounding community. Plainly, we long for these new disciples to make disciples who make disciples (and so on). The two of us are completely ecstatic that we get to be a part of what God is doing in Central Asia! We will be staying in this location for 2 weeks alongside Cru students who may be staying up to 7 weeks. Following our departure, there will be a Stint team in place to follow-up with built relationships and new believers for the purpose of a longer term discipleship process.

We are recognizing our complete dependence upon God, both in fundraising and preparing spiritually for this journey. Both Katie and I are believing God will prepare our hearts and our hands for this mission, through your prayers. We think this is an exciting way for you guys to help spread the Gospel to these "far-away" destinations for those of you who feel the desire to be a part of God’s mission globally but cannot personally go. We are first asking that all of you would be in prayer with us 1) that we would financially raise the means to go, 2) that we would be emboldened by the Spirit to speak of Jesus Christ even when it is difficult and 3) that hearts would be transformed by the power of the Gospel, so that this region, as a whole would direct their worship to the one true God as they also disciple others. Individually, we each need to raise $3,300 by May 7, 2014 (we are hoping to go over the amount given on this specific campaign to reach our collective goal of $6,600 together).

Any type of support you send our way, whether through prayer, encouragement, donation, etc., will be greatly appreciated. Join us in bringing the Gospel to Central Asia!

Grace and peace,

Torrie and Katie

P.S. Spread the word (pun intended)!

story:
We B-E-E Spelling: Bak Too Skool

September 18, 2015 @ The Knitting Factory

Knitting Factory Brooklyn (361 Metropolitan Ave. Brooklyn, NY 11211)
Doors: 7pm, Bee: 8pm sharp 

Select $15 donation to attend, $25 donation to spell

PLUS special after-party performance from Hot Dub Time Machine -- FIRST EVER performance in the U.S.!

If you cannot attend but would still like to support, please donate ANY amount by clicking the top right "Donate Now" button.

100% OF EVENT PROFITS BENEFIT EDUCATION THROUGH MUSIC!

Education Through Music (ETM) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that promotes the use of music in inner-city schools and schools in disadvantaged areas, as a means of enhancing students' academic performance and general development. By providing year-long, in-school music education programs, ETM makes music education a reality for thousands of children who would otherwise have limited or no exposure to the arts.  Our current activities focus on elementary, middle and K-8 schools.

What is a "philanthro-bee"?

We B-E-E Spelling is an adult spelling bee and fundraising event. But this is not the spelling bee you remember from middle school; it's a one-of-a-kind interactive competition with live music, comedy and stage show production to benefit nonprofits making positive change in the world. 

We turn good time funds into money well spent.

Philanthropic giving can be a drag. We created a novel competition to get people excited about taking part in giving, while having the kind of fun you want to have on a Friday night. This lively platform rallies people around organizations making positive change in the world. It seems to work: we've raised over $25,000 for charity to date. 
Join us for a show that will have you laughing and dancing all night -- and it's all for a great cause!
story_txt:
We B-E-E Spelling: Bak Too Skool
September 18, 2015 @ The Knitting Factory

Knitting Factory Brooklyn (361 Metropolitan Ave. Brooklyn, NY 11211)Doors: 7pm, Bee: 8pm sharp 
Select $15 donation to attend, $25 donation to spell
PLUS special after-party performance from Hot Dub Time Machine -- FIRST EVER performance in the U.S.!
If you cannot attend but would still like to support, please donate ANY amount by clicking the top right "Donate Now" button.

story:
Short Summary

Crocus Academy Heartland opened in 2009, and we have been serving Elizabethtown and Hardin County families since then.  We offer a wonderful preschool and prekindergarten environment that provides a quality early education program. 

Your contributions will help provide for a variety of special events and opportunities for our students and their families throughout the school year.  Some of these events include:  Fall Festival, Holiday Celebrations, Parent Events, Graduation and Promotion, Staff Recognition and much, much more!

If you have a child or family member who has experienced some part of what Crocus can do, then please take a moment to make a donation.  You will become a part of helping young families bloom.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are setting our goal at $3,000.00 which is the amount we need each year to help fund all our special activities and bonus events.  This averages to about $100.00 per family and should be easy to achieve.

Fall Festival:  $1,000.00

Christmas Celebrations:  $500.00

Muffins With Mom:  $150.00

Donuts With Dad:  $150.00

Graduation and Promotion:  $500.00

Staff Appreciation:  $500.00

Surprise Events/Items:  $200.00

If we meet our goal, then we can accomplish everything on our list, but if for some reason, we do not, we will put all our funds toward the following in this order:

Fall Festival

Christmas Celebrations

Graduation and Promotion

Staff Appreciation

The Impact

At Crocus Academy, we believe that young children are our greatest asset, and we want them to love school from the moment they enter, and it is our hope that they will love learning their entire lives.  Our goal is to prepare children academically without sacrificing the joy, wonder and curiosity that is natural to children.  We do all of this within the framework of a Bible-based curriculum that teaches all the core content areas of a quality program.  We are laying the foundation for lifelong learners and guiding each child to develop confidence and self-esteem.  Crocus Academy is an organization that you can be proud to support.

Other Ways You Can Help


If you want to support our school, but do not want to participate in the Blooming in Elizabethtown campaign, please feel free to make a donation and mail it to us.  There is no donation too small.  All mailed donations should go to Crocus Academy Main Street, PO Box 728, Bardstown  KY  40004(please put in the memo : Blooming in Elizabethtown.)

You may not be in a position to donate to our campaign, but that does not mean that you cannot help.  Please share our campaign with your friends and families. The more people who donate, the more our students will benefit, so make a lot of noise about Blooming in  Elizabethtown.  Thank you for your support!

story:
Campaign Summary
Welcome to our page! The fact that you are visiting means that you have either seen one of our Slimed for Science campaign videos (were you lucky enough to get tagged by a friend?) or you are interested in contributing to our fundraising effort.
Either way, we welcome you because you and your network can play an important part in  bringing the curiosity, fun, and creativity back to STEM learning!
We're here to bring a state-of-the-art Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM)  Center to El Paso and to promote STEM education across the country!  
El Paso is the 19th largest city in the United States, and it is the only one in the top 25 cities without a dedicated science center.  While Insights El Paso Science Center has been around for 35 years,  it is currently borrowing exhibit space from the El Paso Independent School District until a permanent, dedicated center can be built.  With a growing list of partners invested in brining a STEM center to El Paso, we are more determined than ever to build El Paso the STEM Center it deserves.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to support two major branches of efforts.

  • First, we wish to continue serving the community of El Paso and keep the current Insights Science Center operating while we lay the foundation for a future, dedicated facility.
  • Second, we need major stakeholders to join forces in the effort to strategically plan, purchase, and build the assets that will bring the future STEM Center to fruition.

By contributing to this campaign, you will play a major role in supporting the El Paso region's only STEM learning facility now and in the future.  Moreover, your participation in the Slimed for Science Social Media outlet of this campaign will help bring STEM education, access and opportunity to the forefront of conversations around the country.  Working together, we may just build a network that enhances STEM learning across the country.

Oh, and did we mention the awesome perks?  By participating, you will get some cool swag, recogntion, and that warm-fuzzy feeling in your heart (or is that a slime side-effect?)!

 


The Impact 

Besides helping to educate adult and child visitors, you get to support school field trips, and the well being of the community. Think about all the ways that STEM fields have enhanced our lives... with more inspiring opportunities in El Paso, we can cultivate even more bright minds, rewarding hobbies, and world-changing ideas!

Visit our Slimed for Science FAQ's page to see more about the potential impact and roles you can play to support this movement.

Risks and Challenge

The most rewarding endeavors in life are often the most daunting.  However, we’ve heard from enough El Pasoans that they are indeed committed to bringing a cutting-edge STEM learning center to our city and region. 

It will take support on all levels to make this vision a reality, but that is why we have developed a multi-pronged approach to secure the future for the STEM Center:

  • With local financial support, we can keep the current science center operating long enough to cultivate relationships with major funders – who wish to see a community being served and engaged before investing.

  • Science Centers traditionally look toward corporate and national veins of support to maintain a large portion of their operating budget.  For the first time, our leadership and partners are taking these steps. We have a strong case for STEM education needs in El Paso – from education to industry…

  • We are working with experts in museum and STEM fields in order to build something relevant, interdisciplinary, cutting-edge and accessible.  We have world-class goals for our hometown Science Center.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this link with others.
  • Make a slimed for science video, challenge your friends, and post it on FaceBook, Twitter or your blog! 
  • Post a note (#Slimed4Science) to your networks about how STEM has changed your life for the better?  Does it impact your medical treatment, your career, your hobby, your passion…? 
  • Research local STEM education organizations in your town and volunteer!

Help people think about how STEM education and fields impact our daily lives – from health to daily conveniences, from today’s technologies to tomorrow’s careers, STEM.

Read Our Updates for some Slime Recipes!  Keep in mind that some recipes are not appropriate for children and require proper safety equipment such as gloves or masks.
